Description: Rubbish: Numerous bags of rubbish garbage set out but not picked up
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/2/2015

Nino R & Ethel Barcellino, Richard L Barcellino
561 Newport Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 716 Larimer Ave  on 4/2/2015 at approximately 12:20pm. 

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

In addition to the above code, it's a violation of Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish.  Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

On this date located on this property it was observed that numerous bags of rubbish were set out by the curb but were not disposed.  Please make arrangements to have the rubbish properly disposed of.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Oberserved numerous bags of rubbish / garbage set out by the curb but was not picked up. Looked like somebody cleaned out the rental unit.

Description: Carport / car cover structure blew over is falling down
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/2/2015

Nicholas Drakulic, Nicholas Drakulic & Laura Drakulic
344 Cline St
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 344 Cline St  on 4/2/2015 at approximately 2:00pm. 

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 302.7 Accessory Structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On this date it was observed that the carport or structure covering the vehicle in the front of the property has blown apart and is in disrepair exposing an inoperable vehicle.  Please repair or replace the structure or remove completely.  If the carport is not replaced the vehicle will need to be removed or made operable to be in compliance with township ordinances.  If the structure is replaced be sure that it is permitted under current zoning regulations for your property.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Carport looks like it blew over or apart exposing the car it was covering.  As of 4/27/15 the carport was removed but the vehicle was still in the side yard area of the property.

Description: Roofs and drainage: Gutters were apart and not draining rainwater
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/2/2015

Marian Aboud E S & Nasib
571 Lucia Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 571 Lucia Rd  on 4/2/2015 at approximately 1:30pm. 

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure.  Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

On this date it was observed that the gutters on your property were not attached and rain water was not being properly discharged.  Please fix the gutter system on the property to allow the proper drainage of rainwater from the roof.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: On two separate occasions, most recently 4/2 at 13:30, during a rainstorm water was observed flowing out of the gutter system that was not properly attached.

Description: Motor Vehicle: Unlicensed vehicle in the driveway
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code

4/3/2015

Ashley P Phillis
301 Churchill Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 301 Churchill Rd on 4/3/2015 at approximately 1:00pm. 

*** 302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

2012 International Property Maintenance Code defines an Inoperable Motor Vehicle as: A vehicle which cannot be driven upon the public streets for reason including but not limited to being unlicensed, wrecked, abandoned, in a state of disrepair, or incapable of being moved under its own power.

On this date a blue vehicle was was parked in the driveway of this property inoperable without a displayed license plate.  Please remove the vehicle from the premises or make operable.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed a blue vehicle in the driveway of this property without a license plate displayed.

Description: Rubbish:  Couch at the curb other household items debris on the front porch
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/6/2015

Ronald M & Vergie B Deorio
421 Cline St
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 421 Cline St on 4/6/2015 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

In addition to the above listed violation, Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish states.  Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

2009 International Property Maintenance Code defines rubbish as; combustible and noncombustible waste materials, except garbage; the term shall include the residue from the burning of wood coal, coke and other combustible materials, paper, rags, cartons, boxes, wood, excelsior, rubber, leather, tree branches, yard trimmings, tin cans, metals, mineral matter, glass, crockery and dust and other similar materials.

This letter is a follow up to our conversation on this date for the above listed violations of the township property maintenance code regarding the couch out by the curb for pick up along with the other items on the front porch that are considered to be rubbish.  Please properly dispose of the rubbish and remove it from the front porch of the property.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed a couch out by the curb that has been there for a few days, also a significant collection of rubbish, debris, household items on the front porch.

Description: Rubbish:  Bags left at the curb , mattress was not taken into the garage
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/6/2015

William D Edgar
575 Allegheny Ave
Oakmont, PA 15139

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 702 Mcmasters Ave on 4/6/2015 at approximately 08:30am. 

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish states.  Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

On this date I stopped at the property to follow up on the issue of the mattress and rubbish put out for disposal by one of your tenants when moving and to verify the additional complaints received by my office over the last few days.  As we discussed over the phone on 4/2/2015 the mattress and containers were to have been placed back into the unit or put in the garage until the evening prior (Monday 5:00pm) to the scheduled pick up day (Tuesday) or disposed of properly in some other fashion prior to collection day.  However, the mattress was moved from the curb but still left exposed outside the garage area and the rubbish containers remained at the curb with rubbish and garbage still in them.  Please have the area cleaned up and the items properly disposed following all township ordinances regarding the collection and disposal of garbage and rubbish.  In addition, please advise all current and future tenants of these regulations.

You have three (3) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Continued complaint of rubbish being put out at the curb before the scheduled day, mattress was not put in the garage as the property owner stated he would do on Thursday 4/2.  Called and left messages with mr. edgar regarding the ongoing issues.

Description: Debris & Rubbish:  Wall fell over or was knocked over, old tv and door at the dumpster area
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/6/2015

DFK Monroeville, LLC
1301 Chestnut St
Connellsville, PA 15425

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 3412 William Penn Hwy on 4/6/2015 at approximately 12:15pm. 

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed that a wall of a planter or some form of retaining wall that is located in the front of the building has either been knocked over or torn down to cause it to be in a state of disrepair laying in the parking lot.  In addition to the wall, some rubbish has accumulated in the area where the dumpster was located.  These items where either not taken by the refuse hauler when they removed the dumpster or have been placed there since their removal.  Please have the items removed and the block and debris repaired or removed.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed the wall in front of the old D'imperio's fell, was knocked over or was torn down and was laying exposed as a pile of ruble in the parking lot.  Also, an old tv stand and door are laying where the dumpster was located.

Description: Observation: Follow up to complaint about erosion and retaining wall
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/8/2015

Seligsohn, William T Sr & Chardae
106 Hart Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 106 Hart Dr on 4/8/2015 at approximately 12:10pm 

*** 302.2 Grading and Drainage ***
All premises shall be graded and maintained to prevent the erosion of soil and to prevent the accumulation of stagnant water thereon, or within any structure located thereon.

This letter is a follow up to the conversation I had with Chardae on this date and from the initial observation on 4/2/15 regarding the retaining wall and soil piled up along the privacy fence at the bottom of the paved driveway on your property.  As discussed, please remove the soil that has been piled up next to the fence and this should remedy what is considered soil erosion from storm water runoff.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Follow up to observe the conditions of the water runoff and and potential soil erosion that was occurring around a retaining wall on the property.  A pile of dirt was still piled along the privacy fence at the bottom of the paved driveway which could permit the soil to erode onto adjoining property.  Property owner stated they would remove the soil in question within 30 days.

Description: Rubbish: Refrigerator and other items in the driveway
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/9/2015

Lynn Stoudt
C/o Holmes, Melvin S & Patricia J
124 Powell St
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 124 Powell St on 4/9/2015 at approximately 10:30am this date. 

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2.2 Refrigerators ***
Refrigerators and similar equipment not in operation shall not be discarded, abandoned or stored on premises without first removing the doors.

As a follow up to the conversation with Lynn Stoudt on this date, I'm sending notice that the refrigerator that was observed in the driveway of the property has to be moved inside or have the doors removed immediately.  I advised Lynn the unit can be in the driveway no more than 15 days while waiting to be properly disposed of as long as the doors are off while it is outside. 

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Based upon a complaint, observed a refigerator in the driveway of the property.  Spoke with Lynn Stoudt, the occupant, at 10:30am who stated they were trying to get rid of it but the people they had contacted didn't want to take it.  She said the doors were screwed shut but I explained the doors had to come off if it was going to be outside. I instructed her to have the doors removed as soon as possible and to have the entire unit removed from the driveway within 15 days. Doors were off as of 4/23/15 however the unit was still in the driveway as rubbish.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

On this date, rubbish in the form of a window A/C unit was at the curb of the property that was not picked up by the trash hauler.  In addition, the rubbish containers were knocked over on the entrance sidewalk spilling their contents on the ground.  I attempted to contact a tenant but a schoolaged girl stated her parents were sleeping because they work late at night.  Please have the property cleaned up and dispose of the rubbish properly.  You can contact the Township secretary 412-824-6650 to arrange for the proper disposal of the the A/C unit should you need assistance finding a hauler.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Based upon a complaint. I observed a window A/C unit at the curb that was not pick up. Attempted contact with the occupant a schoolaged girl came to the window and said her parents were sleeping because they work late.

LetterText:
4/9/2015

Sam Folino
C/O Nelson, Crystal - Owner
403 Northern Pike
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 403 Northern Pike on 4/9/2015 at approximately 11:30am 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

*** 308.2.2 Refrigerators ***
Refrigerators and similar equipment not in operation shall not be discarded, abandoned or stored on premises without first removing the doors.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

Rubbish in the form of a stove, refrigerator and household furniture was in the driveway and along the side of the house which is in violation of Township ordinances.  This notice is a follow up to our conversation on this day.  You stated you would have the doors of the refrigerator removed later this date and I gave you 15 additional days to have the rest of the rubbish removed from the exterior of the house or to be disposed of properly.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Based on a neighbor complaint, I observed rubbish / debris in the driveway and along the side of the house that included a refrigerator, stove and some furniture.  The tenant is Sam Folino 412-862-5206 stated the rubbish is that of the owners Crystal Nelson.  He said he was to see her this date and he would get her permission to get rid of the items.  I told him the refrigerator doors needed to be removed asap and he had 15 days to clean everything else up.

It has been observed Tax map Lot # 373-S-120 located between 330 and 324 Cline street in Wilkins has become overgrown with weeds and brush.  Please have the lot maintained and the vegetation reduced to eight inches or less in height.

LetterText:
8/2/2016

Patterson Edward George
546 Wood St  Apt 1
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 377 Kenney Aveon 8/2/2016 at approximately : 1:30PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On August 2, 2016 it was observed that the property mentioned above is in a delapidated state, missing siding, and has a structurally unsafe scaffolding placed on the side of the house which has been there for an excessive amount of time.  Please either repair the house or make plans for demolition.  Also please remove the scaffolding from the house.

*** 302.7 Accessory structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

You have twenty one (21) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: High grass/weeds
LetterText:
8/2/2016

Hampton Estates Llc
501 Grant Ave
Duquesne, PA 15110

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 351 Kenney Aveon 8/2/2016 at approximately : 1:30PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On August 2, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds on the property mentioned above where in excess of borough code.  Please maintain the grass/weeds on the property to a height less than six inches.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

609 Brown Ave

Dear Mcguigan Tyler, Nihart Stephanie:

The following Code Violations were observed on your property located at 609 Brown Ave on 3/26/2015 at approximately 12:15pm in Wilkins Township. 

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 308.2.2 Refrigerators ***
Refrigerators and similar equipment not in operation shall not be discarded, abandoned or stored on premises without first removing the doors.

On this date a refrigerator was observed in the driveway of this property with the doors still attached.  Please move the equipment inside the residence or if to be discarded as rubbish please remove the doors completely from the unit and have the equipment properly disposed of according to the terms of the local refuse hauler contracted with the township.

Description: Rubbish: Debris stored around the property
LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

3/25/2015

James W Alm Jr
2345 Mount Vernon Ave
Export, PA 15632

The following Code Violations were observed on your property located at 0 Harrison Rd on 3/25/2015 at approximately 12:00pm at the intersection of Linhart St and Larimar Ave in Wilkins Township.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

2009 International Property Maintenance Code defines rubbish as; Combustible and noncombustible waste material, except garbage; the term shall include the residue from the burning of wood, coal, coke and other combustible materials, paper, rags, cartons, boxes, wood, excelsior, rubber, leather, tree branches, yard trimmings, tin cans, metals, mineral matter, glass, crockery, and dust and other similar materials.

The rubbish observed on the property includes what appears to be a kitchen counter top, tree branches, logs and other various items.

You have five (5) days to remove the rubbish to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code

3/27/2015

Leonard & Lendina Wright
832 Graham Blvd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221-2520

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 832 Graham Blvd on 3/27/2015 at approximately 10:00am 

*** 302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

2012 International Property Maintenance Code defines an Inoperable Motor Vehicle as: A vehicle which cannot be driven upon the public streets for reason including but not limited to being unlicensed, wrecked, abandoned, in a state of disrepair, or incapable of being moved under its own power.
 
On this date two vehicles parked in the driveway of this property were inoperable due to flat tires on both vehicles.  Please repair the vehicles to make them operable or move them into the closed garage.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722

4/1/2015

Robert R Perkoski
1541 Williamsburg Pl
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violations were observed on your property located at 1541 Williamsburg Pl on 4/1/2015 at approximately 2:45pm

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 304.3 Premises Identification ***
Buildings shall have approved address numbers placed in a position to be plainly legible and visible from the street or road fronting the property.  These numbers shall contrast with their background.  Address numbers shall be Arabic numerals or alphabet letters.  Numbers shall be a minimum of 4 inches in height with a minimum stroke width of 0.5 inch.

On this date it was observed that some rubbish in the form of boxes were located in the front yard along with other various items such as tree trimmings and branches located on the side and rear of the property as viewed from the street.  In addition to the debris in the yard I was not able to clearly see an address for the property as required.  Please clean up and properly dispose of the rubbish and have the address posted for the property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

This notice is a follow up to our conversation on this date regarding the mattress and rubbish placed at the curb of this property when the tenant was moving out.  You stated, as of today, you were going to have the items pulled from the curb until the evening prior to the scheduled collection day for this property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Received a neighbor complaint that a mattress and garbage was placed at the curb from this tenant when moving out before the scheduled pick up day.  Contacted the owner William Edgar 412-828-4600 who stated he was going to place the items back by the house this date and put them back out the night before pick up.

NOTICE OF VIOLATION: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code

4/2/2015

William S Eisel
221 Summers Ave
Monroeville, PA 15146

The following code violation was observed on your property located at 893 Larimer Ave on 4/2/2015 at approximately 09:15am. 

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

2009 International Property Maintenance Code defines rubbish as; Combustible and noncombustible waste materials, except garbage; the term shall include the residue from the burning of wood coal, coke and other combustible materials, paper, rags, cartons, boxes, wood, excelsior, rubber, leather, tree branches, yard trimmings, tin cans, metals, mineral matter, glass, crockery and dust and other similar materials.

On this date it was observed that rubbsih has been scattered along the retaining wall located in front of this property.  Please have the area cleaned up and provide for the tenants approved containers for the storage of rubbish and garbage that by design have close fitting lids.  This notice has been sent to both the occupants and listed property owner

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

LetterText:
4/13/2015

Kane, Judith  & John Sholder
245 Harrison Rd
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 245 Harrison Rd on 4/13/2015 at approximately 11:30am

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish ***
Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

*** 304.3 Premises Identification ***
Buildings shall have approved address numbers placed in a position to be plainly legible and visible from the street or road fronting the property.  These numbers shall contrast with their background.  Address numbers shall be Arabic numerals or alphabet letters.  Numbers shall be a minimum of 4 inches in height with a minimum stroke width of 0.5 inch. 

On this date it was observed numerous bags of rubbish were placed at the curb for pick up two days prior to the scheduled day.  In addition to the rubbish at the curb, rubbish was piled up against the garage door and on the front porch. Also, I was unable to locate a visible address from the street for the property.  Please clean up and properly dispose of the rubbish and refrain from placing items at the curb prior to the scheduled pick up day for this street and please add premises identification.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Description: Rubbish: Retaining wall fell over in the driveway and other debris scattered about the yard, peeling paint on siding
LetterText:
4/15/2015

Kight, Gregory Nicholas
2507 Collins Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 2507 Collins Rd on 4/15/2015 at approximately 11:15am. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

On this date it was observed that the retaining wall has fallen over into the driveway of this property creating an accumulation of rubbish in addition to other items scattered about the front of the property.  Additionally, the exterior siding of the property has become deteriorated with peeling and flaking paint.  Please remove and properly dispose all rubbish from the property and scrape and apply a protective coating to the siding.  

You have fortyfive (45) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed on 2 separate ocassions rubbish accumulated in the driveway of the property and throughout the front yard.  Also, peeling and flaking paint on the siding of the house.

1000 Thompson Run Rd

The following code violation was observed on property located at 0 Rodi Rd on 4/16/2015 at approximately 09:45am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***

LetterText:
4/16/2015

Eles Brothers Co Inc.
1000 Thompson Run Rd
Monroeville, PA 15146

The following code violation was observed on property located at 1235 Rodi Rd on 4/16/2015 at approximately 10:00am 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On this date the above violations were observed at the garage building located in Wilkins Township on parcel 542-J-20.  An inoperable motor vehicle was observed in front of the garage with expired license and in major disrepair.  Rubbish in the form of old motors and equipment was being kept on the side of the garage along with a track operated vehicle or machine being kept in the front of the building.  Please remove and properly dispose of all rubbish and remove or make operable all inoperable vehicles located at the property.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed numerous items of rubbish and inoperable vehicles on the property.

Description: Rubbish, Weeds, Debris: Follow up to ongoing issues for trees down in and on the house and high weeds
LetterText:
4/22/2015

Herron, Edward J & Eleanor M
491 Lucia Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 491 Lucia Rd on 4/22/2015 at approximately 10:20am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date it was observed that rubbish in the form of trees, tree branches and dead leaves have accumulated on the property in addidtion to high weeds, grass and vegetation.  A tree has blown over onto the roof of the house and branches are laying on the roof, rear and side yard.  Also vegetation has grown in excess of eight inches throughout the property.  Please remove and properly dispose all rubbish and maintain the height of the vegetation to eight inches or less.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Follow up with on going issues for trees that have fallen over onto the house high weeds and debris scattered about the property. Front grass cut as of 5/14/15 but back remains overgrown with weeds and the tree is still on the house.

Description: Observation: Apple tree blew over onto fense and roadway
ObservationInfo: Observed an apple tree that has blown over onto the split rail fence and a portion of the roadway.  The home is listed for sale through Coldwell Banker and Wells Fargo.  I spoke with an agent Tim Fabian from Coldwell 412-480-2929 cell 412-363-4000 office @ 13:30 stated he woukld get in contact with the son of the property owner whom has POA to take care of the tree, said he has been responsive to other issues in the past and would keep me informed.

Description: Inoperable vehicle still in driveway spoke with Sheryl about intent to remove
ObservationInfo: Stopped at the house for follow up of the inoperable vehicle in the driveway since somebody was at the residence.  Spoke with a "Brandon" who said the car was his and it would be taken care of.  When walking away he handed me a phone and said the owner of the car wanted to speak w/ me, she said her name was Sheryl and it was her car and said she is having it removed when I asked if she had received the notice of violation.  She then asked if I just go around and look for issues like this and wanted to know why it was a violation, I told her if she needed more time we could could extend the timeframe but she said it would be removed.

Description: Motor Vehicles: Storage of inoperable motor vehicles
LetterText:
4/23/2015

Pushinsky, Michael J & Deborah J
491 Brown Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 491 Brown Ave on 4/23/2015 at approximately 10:30am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

Also, Chapter 141 of the codified ordinances of Wilkins Township covers Storage Yards and states; No person, partnership or corporation shall establish or maintain or permit to exist in the Township of Wilkins any storage yard or other place used for the storage of goods, materials, machinery, equipment, things or vehicles (whether operable or inoperable) except in accordance with the provisions set forth by the chapter.

On this date it was observed that numerous vehicles were in inoperable condition and being stored / kept on the property.  Based on our conversation you were going to start removing or making operable all the vehicles that are being kept under such conditions.

You have sixty (60) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed several inoperable motor vehicles parked / stored on the property.  Spoke with Mike Pushinsky around 10:30 regarding the issue of the vehicles.  He stated he would work on getting them removed from the property.  I advised him he had 60 days to have them removed.

Description: Protective treatment: Peeling, flaking paint on exterior siding of the house.  Based off a complaint
LetterText:
4/27/2015

Doyle, Robert A
707 Mcmasters Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 707 Mcmasters Ave on 4/27/2015 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

On this date it has been observed that the exterior siding of the home is showing signs of significant peeling and flaking paint.  Please have all peeling and flaking paint removed and the surfaces recovered.

You have one hundred twenty (120) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Based upon a complaint, observed peeling, flaking paint on the exterior siding of the house on the property.  Has been an ongoing complaint and notices being sent from the twp.

Description: Rubbish: Garbage cans left at the curb
LetterText:
4/28/2015

Rose, Cheri
2293 Elmhill Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 2293 Elmhill Rd on 4/28/2015 at approximately 10:30am. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #715  Garbage  Rubbish  Recycling ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On this date it was observed that the refuse container was laying behind the shrubs next to the curb at the front of the property.  Some of the left over contents were spilled out onto the ground in the area of the container.  	A maximum of two (2) standard residential garbage cans with lids may be stored at any side or rear yard location properly screened or shielded from adjoining residential properties prior to collection.   All garbage and trash containers shall be properly stored until the designated pick up days when the containers must be brought to the curb.  Also, rubbish in the form of dead leaves and debris have become accumulated along the front of the property and along the walkway and driveway area.  Please remove and properly dispose of the rubbish. 

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Neighbor complaint that this property leaves their refuse container by the curb hidden behind a shrub.  While there it was observed that rubbish in the form of leaves have accumulated along the shrubs and front port of the walkway to the home.

47 Garden Ter
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 47 Garden Ter on 5/5/2015 at approximately 1:00pm. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

International Property Maintenance Code defines rubbish as: Combustible and noncombustible waste materials, except garbage; the term shall include the residue from the burning of wood coal, coke and other combustible materials, paper, rags, cartons, boxes, wood, excelsior, rubber, leather, tree branches, yard trimmings, tin cans, metals, mineral matter, glass, crockery and dust and other similar materials.

On this date I stopped at the residence to speak about rubbish in the form of yard trimmings being dumped over the hillside to the rear of your property onto adjoining property below.  I viewed grass clippings and other vegetation dumped over the hillside which would be in violation of Borough ordinances.  Please properly dispose of all rubbish and if using the grass clippings as compost be sure to maintain the pile on your property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Neighbor complaint from 840 Stevendale stating neighbor is dumping rubbish / yard trimmings over the hillside onto his property.

Description: Rubbish: Tree trimmings and branches piled up and stored in the paper ally
LetterText:
5/6/2015

Bodnar, Janice
621 Beaver Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 621 Beaver Ave on 5/6/2015 at approximately 10:00 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

International Property Maintenance Code defines rubbish as; Combustible and noncombustible waste material, except garbage; the term shall include the residue from the burning of wood, coal, coke and other combustible materials, paper, rags, cartons, boxes, wood, excelsior, rubber, leather, tree branches, yard trimmings, tin cans, metals, mineral matter, glass, crockery, and dust and other similar materials.

As a follow up to the conversation with Mr. Bodnar on this date regarding the tree trimmings and branches, that by definition within the property maintenance code are considered rubbish, and were piled / stored in the Township right of way (paper ally) to the rear of this property.  It was discussed the logs would be restacked on your property and not in the ally way and that the branches would be properly disposed of.

You have sixty (60) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider

Description: Unlicensed wrecked motor vehicle in the driveway and rubbish / trash spilled from container onto the roadway
LetterText:
5/6/2015

Cochrane, Donald  & Diane
621 Washington St
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 621 Washington Ave on 5/6/2015 at approximately 10:00am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On this date I stopped at the residence to follow up with a complaint filed by Mrs. Cochrane on an unrelated matter.  While there I observed an inoperable motor vehicle due to it being unlicensed and wrecked parked in the driveway.  Based upon our phone conversation you stated the vehicle has been totaled by your insurance carrier and that the salvage company is to be removing the vehicle.

You have fortyfive (45) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: When trying to investigate a complaint initiated by this property, I observed an unlicensed, wreck motor vehicle in the driveway and spilled rubbish on the street from their garbage cans.  I spoke with diana Cochrane regarding these issues and she stated that Mocks was to tow the car since her insurance totaled the claim but she said mocks refuses to tow it out of their driveway.  I gave her 45 days to comply.

LetterText:
5/6/2015

Mccully, William
4746 Havana Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15239

The following code violation was observed on property located at 117 Ivy St on 5/6/2015 at approximately 10:45am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date on parcel ID 455-A-302 in the Township of Wilkins it was observed that the grass was in excess of eight inches on the property.  Please maintain the grass height to eight inches or less.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed high grass and weeds on the property.

5/11/2015

Aboud, Marian E S & Nasib
571 Lucia Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 571 Lucia Rd on 5/11/2015 at approximately 10:40am 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure.  Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

On this date as follow up to an initial notice sent 4/2/15 regarding the gutters not being attached to the downspouts, it was observed that the gutters are still not attached to properly discharge rain water.  Please repair or replace the gutter system to properly discharge rain water from the roof.  Also observed was that the grass / weeds were in excess of eight inches on the property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches.

You have fifteen (15) days to fix the gutters and five (5) days to cut the grass / weeds to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

5/12/2015

Roy, Angela L
923 Bradgate Dr
Irwin, PA 15642

The following code violation was observed on property located at 10 Garden Ter on 5/12/2015 at approximately 11:00am. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #715  Garbage  Rubbish  Recycling ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On this date it was observed that rubbish and trash was placed at the curb prior to the scheduled pick up day creating an accumulation of rubbish.  Please remove and refrain from having rubbish placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for the street.  Also, the grass / weeds were in excess of six inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than six inches.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
5/12/2015

Baran, Marti
1531 Williamsburg Pl
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 1531 Williamsburg Pl on 5/12/2015 at approximately 1:10pm. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed an inoperable motor vehicle stored in the driveway of this property.  While attempting to make contact at the front door it was observed rubbish has accumulated on the front porch and along the driveway area.  Please remove or make the vehicle operable with current lincenses and please remove and properly dispose the accumulated rubbish.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.
