LetterText:
5/27/2015

Pferdehirt, Frederick T & Valerie J
37 C  Churchill Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following was observed on property located at 37 C Churchill Rd Block and Lot  371-L-305 on 5/15/2015 at approximately 14:30pm. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** 302.7 Accessory Structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

In regards to the condition of the stone retaining wall that has become deteriorated along the adjoining property line between this address and that of 37 Churchill Rd Block and Lot 371-L-320 information has been reviewed and as it appears through the online Allegheny County Real Estate Mapping the wall is depicted on your property.  As discussed, the only way to accurately determine the location of the wall would be to have the lot surveyed.  The process you have implemented and the steps taken to date to repair the wall are appropriate to complying with the adopted code.  If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to contact me.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Based from an original complaint about their neighbors fence observed a rock retaining wall that has fallen over on the property. At issue is determining ownership of the wall

LetterText:
5/18/2015

Akhter, Bashir
2301 Broomsage Ct
Export, PA 15632

The following code violation was observed on property located at 1418 Jefferson Heights Rd on 5/18/2015 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On this date it was observed that the grass / weeds were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches.  Also observed was an unlicensed maroon colored vehicle stored in the driveway.  Please remove the vehicle or make operable with proper licenses displayed.

You have five (5) days to maintain the grass height and thirty (30) days to remove or make operable the vehicle to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Description: Observation of potential overgrowding based upon complaint from the boro
ObservationInfo: Upon complaint from the Boro staff of potential overgrowding at this property.  Observed 4 vehicles in the driveway but they feel many more people are living there.  Honda Odyssy PA GTS-1625 and JDB-6742 along with a white Cadillac and grey Honda.

Description: Observation based upon complaint from the Boro of possible oil storage on the property
ObservationInfo: Upon complaint from the Boro stating of possible oil storage tanks or drums on the property.  Stated to go to 339 Churchill and look through the backyards.  Went to 339 the Damico's residence but nobody came to the door went to the rear porch door and nobody came to that door.  The properties are surrounded by fences and cannot see over the fence from the rear porch.  Walked the backyard behind the garage on 339 but did not see anything due to the fences.  It looked like some engine work was being done to a black pick up truck in the driveway of 341, truck had the hood up

Description: High grass and inoperable motor vehicle in the driveway
LetterText:
5/19/2015

Olaf, Sayo
34 Holland Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 34 Holland Rd on 5/19/2015 at approximately 12:00pm. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** 302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

On this date it was observed that the grass / weeds were in excess of six inches on this property.  In addition to the high grass it appeared that there was an inoperable motor vehicle being stored in the driveway.  Based from our conversation you stated the vehicle was inoperable but was being sent to South Africa.  Please have the vehicle removed or made operable and please maintain a grass height of less than six inches.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice for the high grass and fortyfive (45) days to comply for the vehicle.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed grass / weeds in excess of six inches as well as what appeared to be an inoperable motor vehicle in the driveway due to it being wrecked or damaged.  Spoke with the occupant Sayo Olaf who stated the vehicle was inoperable but she was sending it to South Africa, gave her 45 days to comply with the vehicle and 5 days to maintain the grass.

LetterText:
5/20/2015

Adamson, Bruce R
111 Patterson St
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 111 Patterson St on 5/20/2015 at approximately 12:00pm. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed that the front porch and sides of this property has an accumulation of rubbish being kept or stored in violation of Township ordinance.  Please properly dispose or remove the accumulated rubbish from the property.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Follow up to removal of inoperable motor vehicles and accumulation of rubbish
LetterText:
5/20/2015

Eles Brothers Co Inc
1000 Thompson Run Rd
Monroeville, PA 15146

The following code violation was observed on property located at 0 Rodi Rd on 5/20/2015 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

As a follow up to the initial notice on parcel 542-N-20 dated 4/16/15, it has been observed that the inoperable motor vehicles have not been removed or made operable that are being kept on this property as well as all the rubbish has not be removed and properly disposed of.  Although some progress has been made towards complying with the original notice, the property is still in violation of Township ordinaces.  This is a second notice.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Follow up to the removal of inoperable vehicles and accumulation of rubbish at both properties operated by Eles Bros on parcels 542-N-20 and 542-J-20.

Description: Observation: based upon neighbor complaint regarding garage door being left open all the time
LetterText:
5/21/2015

Costa, Paul  & Kathleen G
526 Lucia Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following was observed on property located at 526 Lucia Rd on 5/21/2015 at approximately 11:10am. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** 302.5 Rodent Harborage ***
All structures and exterior property shall be kept free from rodent harborage and infestation.  Where rodents are found, they shall be promply exterminated by approved processes which will not be injurious to human health.  After pest elimination, proper precautions shall be taken to eliminate rodent harborage and prevent reinfestation.

Based upon neighbor complaints regarding the garage door always being left open at parcel ID 373-D-76 in the Township of Wilkins, on this date it was observed that the garage door was open and along with having a rubbish container kept in close proximity to the open garage could be a potential for rodent harborage.  Having such conditions would be a violation of Township ordinances.  It is recommended to close the garage door when not in use to prevent rodent harborage. 

If you have any questions regarding this issue please feel free to contact me at a time which is convenient for you and I would be happy to discuss the matter in greater detail.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Based upon neighbor complaint regarding the garage door being left open all the time.

5/22/2015

Stein, Rachel
341 Churchill Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 341 Churchill Rd on 5/22/2015 at approximately 12:30 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed what appeared to be an inoperable motor vehicle due to the vehicle in the same position with the hood up over several days with no movement being kept in the driveway of this property. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

LetterText:
6/1/2015

Martin, Donna C
971 Greensburg Pike
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on property located at 971 Greensburg Pike on 6/1/2015 at approximately 11:15am.

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.2 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored in any residential yard area not part of a garage driveway.

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure.  Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

On this date it was observed that a vehicle was parked in the yard area of this property and the downspouts were not attached to the gutters.  Please park in the driveway or provide for a parking space using driveway stones .  Also please attach the downspouts to the gutters or provide for a means to properly discharge rain water from the roof without a creating a nuisance to other properties.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
6/2/2015

Murcek, Mary Anne
344 Homer Dr
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 344 Homer Dr on 6/2/2015 at approximately 10:35am. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 304.15 Doors ***
All exterior doors, door assemblies, operator systems if provided, and hardware shall be maintained in good condition.  Locks at all entrances to dwelling units and sleeping units shall tightly secure the door.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

On this date it was observed that the garage door at this property showed signs of significant disrepair, also observed was that the grass / weeds were in excess of six inches on the day I was there.  I attempted to make contact in person but nobody was available to answer the door.  Please repair the garage door and maintain a grass height of less than six inches.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice for the weeds and fortyfive (45) days to comply for the garage door.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed that the garage door showed signs of severe deterioration.  Stopped at he home but nobody came to the door.

Description: Follow up on retaining wall also observed weeds in excess of six inches

LetterText:
6/3/2015

Taylor, Anthony H
103 Highpoint Dr  Apt 207
Romeoville, IL 60446

The following code violation was observed on property located at 726 Negley Ave on 6/3/2015

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date it was observed that unsanitary conditions existed and that the grass / weeds were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please clean the property of all rubbish and maintain a grass height of less than eight inches.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Observed high grass / weeds and sanitation conditions

LetterText:
6/4/2015

Caprara, Michael A
806 Larimer Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 806 Larimer Ave on 6/4/2015 at approximately 10:15am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On this date it was observed that an inoperable (due to expired license and flat front tire) motor vehicle is being kept on this property.  Please make operable, move the vehicle into storage or remove all together from the premises to comply with Township ordninance.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

6/4/2015

Fish, William J & Maye M
715 Mcmasters Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 715 Mcmasters Ave on 6/4/2015 at approximately 10:20am 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.2 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored in any residential yard area not part of a garage driveway.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed that a blue in color motor vehicle was parked in the side yard area of this property.  I came to the door attampting to make contact but nobody answered the door.  While there it was observed that there is a pile of rubbish starting to accumulate in the side yard.  Please park in an approved space and remove or properly dispose of the accumulated rubbish.

Description: Vehicle parked in the rear yard area of the property
LetterText:
6/8/2015

Sneed, Lorene R
134 Wallace Ave
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on property located at 134 Wallace Ave on 6/8/2015 at approximately 10:30am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.2 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored in any residential yard area not part of a garage driveway.

On this date it was observed that a grey Saturn PA plate DCS-2328 was parked in the rear yard of this property next Cherry Way.  Based on our conversation you stated the vehicle was operated by your husband and he has been parking there for a number of years and that you were unaware of the Township ordinance prohibiting parking in the yard area.  I advised you that if you plan to continue to park in this location you would have to provide for an approved parking space using stone or other approved driveway material.  Please do not park in the yard area of the property or if you do please provide an approve parking space.

You have fortyfive (45) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: While looking into a separate issue on Cherry way it was observed that a motor vehicle Grey Saturn PA plate #DCS-2328 was parked in the rear yard of 134 Wallace Ave.  I spoke to the occupant at 134 Wallace and she stated it was her husbands car and he has parked there for 20 years and was not aware of any ordinance against it.  I told her they have 45 days to provide for an approved parking space in the rear.

Description: Accumulation, improper storage of rubbish bags at the curb prior to scheduled day
LetterText:
6/8/2015

Jacob, Michael A & Joyce M
201 Noel Dr
Monroeville, PA 15146

The following code violation was observed on property located at 105 Powell St on 6/8/2015 at approximately 1:10pm. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish ***
Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed that items had been placed at the curb for refuse pick up and the contents of the bags and cans were scattered about the yard and left driveway area of this property.  Please refrain from placing or storing refuse containers or bags of rubbish or garbage at the curb prior to the scheduled pick up day for this street.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed that conditions at this property are starting to deteriorate.  High grass and weeds in excess of six inches are visible in the rear and rubbish in the form of leaves and tree branches have accumulated on the sides and front of the house.  Please maintain a grass height of less than six inches on all portions of the property and remove or properly dispose of all accumulated rubbish.

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
6/23/2015

Bush, Catherine F
3759 Greensburg Pike
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 3759 Greensburg Pike on 6/23/2015 at approximately 11:15am. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 303.1 Swimming Pools ***
Swimming pools shall be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition, and in good repair.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #715  Garbage  Rubbish  Recycling ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection. On this date it was observed that the swimming pool located on this property has a cover in place that is holding excessive water on it which could be a potential breeding area for insects due to the stagnant water conditions.  Please drain the water from the pool cover or provide for another means to effectively prevent the collection of stagnant water on the cover.  Also observed this date was a garbage bag placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street.  Please refrain from placing refuse items at the curb prior to the scheduled pick up day. 

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice for the swimming pool and five (5) days to comply for the garbage bag at the curb.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
6/25/2015

Aboud, Marian E S & Nasib
571 Lucia Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 571 Lucia Rd on 6/25/2015 at approximately 12:25pm. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.2 Disposal of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date as a continued follow up on conditions it was observed that the rubbish container was knocked over spilling the contents onto the ground.  Also observed were weeds in excess of eight inches in the front and sides of the property.  Please properly store the rubbish in approved containers with tight fitting lids and maintain a grass height of less than eight inches on all portions of the property.  Additionally, a citation has been issued with the local district magistrate for failure to comply with past notices for the gutter and downspout on the front of the house.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Follow up of conditions observed rubbish scattered about the driveway area and high weeds, throughout.  Gutter remained separated from the downspout.

6/30/2015

Wright, Lendina & Leonard
832 Graham Blvd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 832 Graham Blvd on 6/30/2015 at approximately 12:30pm. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

On this date as a continued follow up regarding the two inoperable motor vehicles being kept in the driveway of this property it was observed that the vehicles are still inoperable and have not be removed from the property.  An additional 45 days on top of the requested 30 day grace period has come to pass with no action.  This is the third notice on the matter and if not complied within the specified timeframe a citation will be issued with the District Magistrate.  Please make the vehicles operable or remove them from the property.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

LetterText:
7/6/2015

Pushinsky, Michael J & Deborah J
491 Brown Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 491 Brown Ave on 7/6/2015 at approximately 12:40pm. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

Also, Chapter 141 of the codified ordinances of Wilkins Township covers Storage Yards and states; No person, partnership or corporation shall establish or maintain or permit to exist in the Township of Wilkins any storage yard or other place used for the storage of goods, materials, machinery, equipment, things or vehicles (whether operable or inoperable) except in accordance with the provisions set forth by the chapter.

On this date as a follow up to the initial notice dated 4/23/2015 regarding the inoperable motor vehicles being kept or stored on this property it was observed that the conditions remain the same and that the storage of the vehicles continue in violation of Township ordinance.  Please remove or make operable all vehicles that are being stored on the property.  This is a second notice.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

Description: Motor vehicle parked in the yard excessive weeds in the back of the home
LetterText:
7/6/2015

Martin, Donna C
971 Greensburg Pike
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on property located at 971 Greensburg Pike on 7/6/2015 at approximately 10:30pm. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.2 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored in any residential yard area not part of a garage driveway.

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure.  Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date as a follow up on conditions from my initial notice sent dated 6/1/2015 it was observed that you are still parking in the grassy area of the yard and have not place gravel down to provide for an approved space.  The downspouts are still detached from the gutters of the home and now weeds in excess of eight inches have overgrown the back of your house.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches on all portions of the property.  Please repair, replace or remove the damaged downspouts so as not to create a nuisance to adjoining properties or public streets when discharging rain water from the roof and please provide for an approved parking space or do not park in the grassy yard area of the property.  From our conversation on this day you had stated you will be working towards compliance to resolve these issues.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Spoke w/ Donna as a follow up from the initial notice from 6/1/15 regarding the vehicle being parked in the grassy area again as well as the downspouts still were not attached to th gutters and the excessive weed growth in the rear of her property.  When I stopped to talk she statedshe was just coming out to move her vehicle but she stated she had it parked in the yard since Friday because she didn't feel well.  I advised her about the weeds in the rear of the house and she started to complain about people pumping musicinto her home through the registers and that people have been coming into her home uninvited?  It appears she has some issues with regard to her mental being and may need more intervention from an outside agency to gain compliance

Bagster in the driveway, accumulation of rubbish
LetterText:
7/6/2015

Smith, Kenneth R & Michelle I
4052 Miller St
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 4052 Miller St on 7/6/2015 at approximately 10:20am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On this date it was observed that for several weeks a "Bagster" type dumpster container has been in the driveway of this property and is considered an accumulation rubbish.  Please have the container removed from the property by the refuse hauler.

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: bagster remains in the driveway as an accumulation of rubbish.  Spoke w/ service cutting grass stated property is bank owned & maintained?

Description: No action from Suntrust to date additional notice sent to listed property owner
LetterText:
7/6/2015

Rudolph, Gregory
817 Elizabeth St
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 817 Elizabeth St on 7/6/2015 at approximately 10:25am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 308.2.2 Refrigerators ***
Refrigerators and similar equipment not in operation shall not be discarded, abandoned or stored on premises without first removing the doors.

On this date as well as 6/11/2015 it was observed that the weeds / grass were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Also observed was a refrigerator on the back deck that was not in operation but still had the doors attached.  Since we had spoken on the phone you had stated that you no longer owned the property, attempts were made to have the listed bank Suntrust service the property but have not be responsive.  As of this date you are still currently listed as the owner of the property through county records and unless indicated otherwise responsible for the conditions of the property.  Please maintain a grass / weed height of less than eight inches both front and rear and remove the doors from the refrigerator while being stored on the rear deck

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: No action from Suntrust to date additional notice sent to listed property owner

Ordinance 726, bagster in the driveway for a few weeks
LetterText:
7/7/2015

Davis, Copa
2426 Marbury Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following observed on property located at 2426 Marbury Rd on 7/7/2015 at approximately 10:20am. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #726  Bulk Containers ***
Registration and permit required for any use of a bulk container in excess of thirty days.  A permit must be obtained from the Borough by filing an application which shall identify the purpose, placement and proposed location of the bulk container.

On this date it was observed that a "Bagster" type dumpster has been in the driveway of this property for a few weeks.  This type of dumpster is considered a bulk container and subject to the requirements of the enacted ordinance if the unit will remain in place.  

Please let this letter serve as a reminder that if the container remains on site past the first week in August a permit will need to be obtained.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Bagster has been in the driveway of the property for a few weeks.

The following code violation was observed on property located at 1918 Beulah Rd on 7/7/2015 at approximately 1:30pm.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #715  Garbage  Rubbish  Recycling ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On this date it was observed that refuse was placed at the curb prior to the scheduled pick up day for the street.  Please refrain from placing items at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day to avoid violations for accumulation of rubbish.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

I explained I had spoken w/ Ms Bush regarding the pool and that she drained it last week and she was going to try to keep it drained and that I would try and make contact w/ her again regarding the pool and now the grass.

Description: Stopped in and was able to speak w/ Ms Bush regarding conditions, she stated she would keep the water drained and was trying to find someone to cut her grass but had no phone service. I contacted Verizon and they were sending a tech out on 7/9 to repair
LetterText:
7/8/2015

Bush, Catherine F
3759 Greensburg Pike
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following was observed on property located at 3759 Greensburg Pike on 7/8/2015 at approximately 12:15pm. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

On this date I stopped in to follow up on the progress of conditions from the initial notice dated 6/23/2015 concerning the excess water accumulated on the cover of the in-ground pool that is not in use.  I saw that water was being pumped from the pool on 6/30/2015 but with recent rain and an additional complaint from the Borough I wanted to see how much water had accumulated again.  

My observation concluded that water had again accumulated in the unused pool and will require draining to maintain sanitary conditions and prevent potential insect infestation due to stagnant water.  Also observed was the weeds / grass on the property were in excess of six inches and will require to be maintained.  During our conversation you had stated your brother David would help maintain the grass.  

In conclusion please maintain sanitary conditions by keeping stagnant water from accumulating in the unused swimming pool and keep the grass / weeds to a height of less than six inches.  Should you have any questions or would like to speak in greater detail regarding this matter you may contact me at my office 412-372-3831 or 412-419-8522

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Stopped in and was able to speak w/ Ms Bush regarding conditions, she stated she would keep the water drained and was trying to find someone to cut her grass but had no phone service. I contacted Verizon and they were sending a tech out on 7/9 to repair the line.  Also called her brother david 412-596-6571 to see if he could be any help l/m w/ him 13:20.  She has some health / mental issues that may require further attention or outside agency to check on welfare in the future.

Description: Spoke with w/ David Casteel regarding his sister Ms. Bush he stated he would go over and try to cut the grass / weeds but was not sure if she'd let him but he said he would go and at least try again
ObservationInfo: Spoke with w/ David Casteel regarding his sister Ms. Bush he stated he would go over and try to cut the grass / weeds but was not sure if she'd let him but he said he would go and at least try again.

Description: Spoke with Rachel @ 15:00 stated she has medical conditions and no transportation except for every 2-3 weeks and didn't know it wasagainst the law to have high grass in the back yard stated she would have it all cut by 8/1
LetterText:
7/9/2015

Stein, Rachel
341 Churchill Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following is regarding property located at 341 Churchill Rd on 7/9/2015: 

On this date based upon our phone conversation at approximately 3:00pm.  We had spoken about the notice you received for high weeds and grass located on this property dated 6/23/2015 and that you had been to the property on 7/3/2015 to cut the front yard.  I explained that you would be receiving another notice dated 7/7/2015 stating you are still in violation since the rear yard portion is still in excess of six inches of which you stated you didn't know the back had to be maintained as well.  You also stated that due to recent medical conditions in conjunction with not being able to get transportation or drive you could only make it to this property every 2-3 weeks.  

I informed you that the next step of the process if not in compliance with the ordinance was to issue a citation for the condition of high weeds.  You stated you would have the front and rear yards maintained before 8/1/2015 and I am acceptable to the extended timeframe.  Please maintain the grass / weed height of less than six inches on all portions of the property.  

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer
ObservationInfo: Spoke with Rachel @ 15:00 stated she has medical conditions and no transportation except for every 2-3 weeks and didn't know it was against the law to have high grass in the back yard stated she would have it all cut by 8/1.  She said she just received the notice dated 6/23 and that I was wrong since she just cut it 7/3, I explained she'd be receiving another notice indicating I saw the front was cut but the rear was still high.  She said I should just leave her alone but I told her the next step was to issue a citation she said it would be a few weeks until she could get there but said it would be all maintained by 8/1

Description: Continuation rubbish container placed by the curb prior to scheduled pick up day no lid on
LetterText:
7/9/2015

Martin, Donna C
971 Greensburg Pike
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on property located at 971 Greensburg Pike on 7/9/2015 at approximately 10:30am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

*** 308.3.2 Containers ***
The operator of every establishment producing garbage shall provide, and at all times cause to be utilized, approved leakproof containers provided with close-fitting covers for the storage of such materials until removed from the premises for disposal.

*** Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish ***
Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

On this day it was observed that a rubbish / garbage container was placed at the curb prior to the scheduled pick up day for this street.  The container being used to store the rubbish / garbage did not have a lid.  Please provide rubbish / garbage containers with close-fitting lids and refrain from placing the containers at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

The following was observed on property located at 934 Greensburg Pike on 7/9/2015 at approximately 10:15am

Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

On this date based on a request from the Township of Wilkins it was observed that the hedges on this property were obscuring the vision of vehicles exiting the intersection of Ridge St onto Greensburg Pike.  Please be advised that the Township regulates the height of hedges under current Zoning regulations.

173-19 Fences which states: 
On corner lots, no vegetation hedge or fence exceeding 36 inches in height shall be erected within 50 feet of the intersecting street lines, except split rail and chain link fences not more than 48 inches in height may be enacted.

Accumulation, improper storage of rubbish / garbage, placing storing containers at the curb prior to scheduled pick up, vehicle parked in the grass
LetterText:
7/13/2015

Jacob, Michael A & Joyce M
201 Noel Dr
Monroeville, PA 15146

The following code violation was observed on property located at 105 Powell St Lot and Block 373-L-282 on 7/13/2015 at approximately 10:20am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 308.3.2 Containers ***
The operator of every establishment producing garbage shall provide, and at all times cause to be utilized, approved leakproof containers provided with close-fitting covers for the storage of such materials until removed from the premises for disposal.

*** 302.8.2 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored in any residential yard area not part of a garage driveway.

*** Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish ***
Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

On this date it was observed that items had been placed at the curb for refuse pick up and the contents of the containers were scattered about the yard and left driveway area of this property.  Please refrain from placing or storing refuse containers or bags of rubbish or garbage at the curb prior to the scheduled pick up day for this street.  Also, please provide for and or utilize rubbish and garbage containers that have close fitting lids.  A similar notice was sent dated 6/8/2015, additional occurrences may result in the issuance of a citation with the district magistrate. 

Additionally, it was observed that a vehicle was being parked or kept in the grass area on the side of the driveway which is also in violation of township ordinance.  Please remove the vehicle from the grass or provide for an approved parking space using driveway stone or similar material.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Follow up on condition of siding / painting
LetterText:
7/14/2015

Kight, Gregory Nicholas
2507 Collins Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 2507 Collins Rd on 7/14/2015 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

On this date as a follow up to the initial notice dated 4/15/2015 it was observed that the protective treatment / painting was still in process but not completed.  It was noted that the retaining wall and rubbish have been taken care of and your efforts regarding that are appreciated.  In regards to the protective treatment for the siding the property maintenance code is silent on appearance however, it does state that any peeling or flaking paint needs to be removed and the surface recoated.  With the ladder still in place I can only presume you are still working on the siding and the protective treatment.  If you would like to discuss this mater in greater detail please don't hesitate to contact my office at 412-372-3831.  This is a second notice.

You have fortyfive (45) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
7/13/2015

Karen Tokarsky - Executrix
612 Romine Ave
McKeesport, PA 15132

C/O Tokarsky, Karl  & Marie
650 Mortimer Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 650 Mortimer Ave on 7/1/2015 at approximately 10:50am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date it was observed that the weeds / grass were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches.  

A notice was sent to the listed address but was returned as undeliverable with no forwarding address.  The Mckeesport address was obtained from Wilkins Twp records.  You have 5 days from the date on this notice to comply.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Chickens being kept, letter sent stating the Twp considers chickens a prohibited animal under Chapter 65-18 codified ordinance
LetterText:
7/16/2015

Gallippi, William
131 Powell St
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was on property located at 131 Powell St on 7/16/2015.

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

It was brought to the attention of this office that chickens are possibly being kept on this property.  If in fact poultry is being kept, please let this letter serve as notice that Wilkins Township regulates animals under Chapter 65 of the codified ordinances with Section 65-18 stating; No person is permitted to maintain, keep or possess within the Township any of the following animals; Z:Poultry (ducks, chickens, swans, geese, turkey and guinea fowl) are prohibited.  If chickens are being kept please have them removed from the property.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

The following code violation was observed on property located at 702 Mcmasters Ave on 7/20/2015 at approximately 10:35am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date as a follow up to the initial notice dated 7/9/2015 it was observed that the weeds / grass were still in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches on the property.  This is a second notice.

LetterText:
7/5/2016

Bbjd Ventures Llc
15400 Knoll Trail  Ste 350
Dallas, TX 75248

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1153 North Aveon 7/5/2016 at approximately : 10:15 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** §5-304 1.11.3 Unsafe Conditions ***
All structures or existing equipment that are or hereafter become unsafe or deficient because of inadequate means of egress facilities, or that constitute a fire hazard or are otherwise dangerous to human life or the public welfare, or that involve illegal or improper occupancy or inadequate maintenance, shall be deemed unsafe. A vacant structure that is not secured against entry shall be deemed unsafe. Unsafe structures or equipment shall be reported to the building code official, who shall take appropriate

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior  of the structure.  Drains, Gutters and Downspouts shall be maintained in good repair.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

On July 5 2016 it was observed that at at the property of 1153 North Ave, Pitcairn PA 15140, The tarp that was being used to prevent flooding within the house from the roof had blown off and now hangs from the side of the house.  It was also observed that the gutter and downspout on the right side of the roof has fallen off completely and lies in the yard next to the house.  It can also be observed from the road that the door to the garage in the back yard is open and not secured.  Please repair the roof, remove the tarp, repair and or replace the gutter, and fasten all doors to all vacant structures to be within township code.  

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

You have fourteen (14) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

Please trim grass/weeds into township compliance and maintain future compliance.  A property reinspection will take place on or about 7/21/2016  

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Brian Scofield
Code Enforcement Officer/Manager

LetterText:
7/20/2015

R & G Plumbing Inc
974 Greensburg Pike
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on property located at 4305 Greensburg Pike on 7/20/2015 at approximately 11:10am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this dated it was observed that the weeds / grass were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches on the property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
7/23/2015

Beveridge, Robert
115 Churchill Rd
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 115 Churchill Rd on 7/23/2015 at approximately 11:50am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On this date it was observed that a red vehicle with PA plate #JBJ-5379 is being stored or kept on the vacant lot next to this property and shares a driveway access with yours.  A notice was sent 7/13/2015 to the owners of the vacant lot (454-L-102) regarding the inoperable motor vehicle due to expired registration being displayed and asking for the vehicle to be removed or made operable with current license.  If the vehicle belongs or is operated by you please remove or make operable with current license or if you do not know who owns the vehicle please contact this office and arrangments will be made with Wilkins Twp police to help identify the owner.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.
