Description: Additional complaint of keeping chickens, stopped back at the property N/A at the door observed rubbish / garbage containers still storing items w/ no lids
LetterText:
7/23/2015

Gallippi, William
131 Powell St
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on property located at 131 Powell St on 7/23/2015 at approximately 11:15am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

*** 308.3.2 Containers ***
The operator of every establishment producing garbage shall provide, and at all times cause to be utilized, approved leakproof containers provided with close-fitting covers for the storage of such materials until removed from the premises for disposal.

On this date as a follow up to the notice sent 7/13/2015 and an additional complaint from Wilkins Twp regarding keeping poultry on this property it was observed that when I stopped at 11:15 am nobody was available to come to the door but I did notice rubbish / garbage containers being kept or stored in the driveway with contents in them but no lids were on the containers, this is a violation of Township ordinance.  Additionally, poultry (chickens and ducks) are prohibited animals and are not permitted to be kept on property within Wilkins Twp.  If these animals are being kept please remove them from the property.  This is a third notice.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #726  Bulk Containers ***
Registration and permit required for any use of a bulk container in excess of thirty days.  A permit must be obtained from the Borough by filing an application which shall identify the purpose, placement and proposed location of the bulk container.

On this date it was observed that a "Bagster" type dumpster has been in the driveway of this property for a few weeks.  This type of dumpster is considered a bulk container and subject to the requirements of the enacted ordinance if the unit will remain in place.

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

Occupncy Re-Inspection
Items (rolled carpet) at the curb prior to scheduled collection
LetterText:
9/30/2015

Nee, Katelyn
2331 Forest Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 2331 Forest Dr on 9/30/2015 at approximately 12:05pm. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On 9/30/2015 it was observed that items were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street in violation of the Code.  Please refrain from placing items for refuse pickup at the curb prior to the time as regulated by §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
10/9/2015

Murcek, Jon & Mary Anne
344 Homer Dr
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 344 Homer Dr, Lot & Block #372-C-240, on 10/9/2015 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** Chapter 236 Article I Residential Storage ***

*** §236-1 Prohibited Acts ***
No person, partnership or corporation shall establish or maintain or permit to exist in the
Borough of Churchill any storage yard or other place used for the storage of goods, materials,
machinery, equipment, things or vehicles (whether operable or inoperable) in the residential
districts of the borough.

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

*** §304.15 Doors ***
All exterior doors, door assemblies, operator systems if provided, and hardware shall be maintained in good condition.  Locks at all entrances to dwelling units and sleeping units shall tightly secure the door.

On 10/9/2015 as a follow up to notices dated 6/2/2015, 7/17/2015 and 9/1/2015 it was observed that the boat and work trailer remain to be kept or stored in the yard area of this property in violation of the Code and that the garage door remains damaged and deteriorated also in violation of the Code.  When we spoke in person on 9/1/2015 you stated you were aware of the violation notices and would be working to be in compliance of these violations however, no action has been observed to date.  Please remove the boat and work trailer from the premises and repair or replace the garage door.  If no action is taken within the specified timeframe a citation will be filed with the District Magistrate. 

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal. LetterText:
10/27/2015

Walter, David M & Danielle M
2071 Hampstead Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 2071 Hampstead Dr on 10/27/2015 at approximately 09:30am. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-17 Collection Procedures for Leaves ***
Collection of leaves may be made on such days of the week and at such times as shall be determined by the Borough Council or the Borough Manager. Leaves for collection shall be placed in paper biodegradable bags. Leaves shall not be placed in plastic bags. The collector shall employ suitable equipment that will properly confine the leaves so that they will be transported over streets of the Borough without spillage or littering of the streets.

On 10/27/2015 it was observed that the leaves on this property were not collected by placing in biodegradable containers but were what appeared to be blown into a pile by the curb of the roadway.  If leaves are to be collected they must be placed into proper containers for disposal and not blown or piled along the curbs.  Please follow the provisions as regulated by the Code for the collection and disposal of leaves.  If further information regarding the collection of leaves and the days they will be collected please contact the Borough office at 412-241-7113. 

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Lee, George K
1527 Williamsburg Pl
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1527 Williamsburg Pl on 10/28/2015 at approximately 11:15am. 

*** Chapter 236 Article I Residential Storage ***

*** §236-3 Front Yards ***
No portion of the front yard ordained in Chapter 304, Zoning, shall be used for the storage or installation of goods, materials, machinery, equipment, things or vehicles (except when vehicles are parked in a defined driveway connected directly to a garage or residence). In addition, no freestanding aboveground containers or cans for trash and/or garbage may be stored in the front yard between periodic pickup dates.

On 10/28/2015 in addition to 10/23 & 10/27/2015 it was observed that vehicles were being parked or stored in the front yard of this property in violation of the Code.  At various times a purple and a white vehicle were observed in a grassy area next to the driveway of the property.  Please remove any vehcile being parked or kept in the front yard or if parking continues in this location next to the driveway provide for a base layer of driveway stone or other approved driveway material.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 225 Kingston Dr on 11/2/2015 at approximately 3:00pm. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On 11/2/2015 it was observed that a TV was placed out as rubbish however, this type of electronic is no longer accepted by the Township refuse hauler.  The TV can be taken to Best Buy to be recycled free of charge or if no longer accepted there a company called eLoop in Plum (877-742-4809) will take the set and properly dispose of it.  If the set remains at the curb it will be considered an accumulation of rubbish and subject to the provisions of the regulation and in violation of Township ordinance.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:

Sharif, Oronde & Latonya Salley-Sharif

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1411 Old Beulah Rd on 4/1/2016 at approximately 10:10am. 

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

*** §302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

On 4/1/2016 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle was being kept or stored on this property in violation of the Code.  A maroon colored passenger vehicle with no registration plate was observed parked or stored in the driveway of the property.  When stopping at the residence in an attempt to make contact regarding a separate potential issue I notice the vehicle in the driveway.  Please remove the inoperable vehicle from the premises or make it operable with all current and valid licenses.  I have made several attempts to speak regarding the initial concerns about the adjoining property and most recently left my card in the door.  Please contact me at your earliest convenience to discuss that matter.  

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal. Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the .  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 468 Broadway on 7/15/2016 at approximately : 

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
A certain document, three copies of which are on file in the office of the Borough Secretary of the Borough of Pitcairn, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2006 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of Pitcairn, in the State of Pennsylvania, for regulating and governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Property Maintenance Code on file in the office of the Borough of Pitcairn are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 307.2 Disposal of rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 307.3.2 Containers ***
The operator of every establishment producing garbage shall provide, and at all times cause to be utilized, approved leakproof containers provided with close-fitting covers for the storage of such materials until removed from the premises for disposal.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

You have fourteen (14) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

Please trim all overgrown weeds/grass on property and maintain a sanitary environment.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Brian Scofield
Code Enforcement Officer/Manager

LetterText:
8/10/2015

Johnson, Melissa L & Brian W
541 Lucia Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 912 Elizabeth St, Lot & Block #372-L-230 on 8/10/2015 at approximately 10:20am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date it was observed that the weeds / grass were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches on the property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
8/11/2015

Stadler, Donna J
416 Woodland Hills Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following was observed on property located at 416 Woodland Hills Dr on 8/11/2015 at approximately 10:40am. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #715  Garbage  Rubbish  Recycling ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On this date it was observed that bags of what appeared to be rubbish were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled refuse pick up day for this street.  Please refrain from placing items at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Description: Bagster remained in the driveway past 30 days violation notice sent for ordinanace 726
LetterText:
8/11/2015

Scaglione, Vincent Jr 
424 Woodland Hills Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 424 Woodland Hills Dr on 8/11/2015 at approximately 10:50am. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #726 Bulk Containers ***

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #726  Bulk Containers ***
Registration and permit required for any use of a bulk container in excess of thirty days.  A permit must be obtained from the Borough by filing an application which shall identify the purpose, placement and proposed location of the bulk container.

As a follow up to the notice dated 7/7/2015 it was observed that the "Bagster" type driveway dumpster remained in the driveway of this property greater than 30 days without a permit which is in violation of the Borough ordinance for bulk containers.  Please remove or obtain a permit for the bulk container in the driveway to avoid any additional violations on the property.

York, Shirley A
2260 William Penn Hwy
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Description: Follow up to the inoperable motor vehicle being kept in the side yard
LetterText:
8/12/2015

Drakulic, Nicholas
344 Cline St
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

The following code violation was observed on property located at 344 Cline St on 8/10/2015 at approximately 10:30am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

As a continued follow up to the storing of an inoperable motor vehicle in the side yard of this property it was observed that the vehicle remains in this location.  When speaking with you on 7/13/2015 it was stated you were in the process of clearing a space in the garage to place the vehicle.  This has been ongoing since the initial contact on 4/2/2015 and subsequent contact on 5/4/2015, 6/11/2015 and 6/16/2015 to resolve this issue.  If the vehicle is not removed or made operable within the specified timeframe a citation will be filed with the District Magistrate's office.

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Occupancy Re-Inspection
Asked to send notice reminding owner of the understanding established between Boro Mgr and him regarding the 50% open requirement for fences in the front yard
LetterText:
8/14/2015

Mcneill, Stephanie G & Andrew
2337 Greensburg Pike
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following was observed on property located at 2337 Greensburg Pike on 8/14/2015 at approximately 10:10am. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

Based upon previous contact and conversations regarding the installation of a fence on this property, please let this letter serve as a reminder of the Churchill Borough zoning requirement as outlined below stating all fences located in the front yard are to be 50% open.

Zoning District Regulations - Fences, Section 304-16
A fence may be erected into any required side or rear yard if the fence is no more than six feet in height for residential uses. A fence which is at least 50% open as to construction and which is no more than three feet high may be erected in any required residential front yard. A fence must be erected so that its finished side, if any, faces the street or abutting property.

Please remove the number of slats needed to achieve a 50% open construction as required for fences located in the front yard.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider

As a continued follow up on conditions and the most recent notice dated 7/20/2015 it was observed that the conditions regarding the sanitation and accumulation of rubbish remained unchanged and in violation of Wilkins Township property maintenance ordinance.

The sanitation and accumulation of rubbish and debris located on this property, Lot & Block 454-D-64 remains unchanged, you had requested a timeframe extension to have the parcel cleaned up and it was granted to extend the compliance date to 8/12/2015.  No action has been taken to resolve the listed code violations to date.  This letter will serve as the third and final notice of violation.  Please remove all accumulated rubbish and debris from the property, if it is not cleaned up in the timeframe indicated a citation will be issued with the District Magistrate's office. 

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Storing keeping an inoperable motor vehicle on the property
LetterText:
8/17/2015

Alm, James W Jr
2345 Mount Vernon Ave
Export, PA 15632

The following code violation was observed on property located at 0 Harrison Rd, Lot & Block #454-D-64, on 8/17/2015 at approximately 09:35am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On this date it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle (red dump truck, expired inspection displayed) is being stored or kept on this property.  Please make the vehicle operable with current license or remove the vehicle from the property.  

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Description: High weeds / grass
LetterText:
8/17/2015

Palanisamy, Balaji
892 Stevendale Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following code violation was observed on property located at 892 Stevendale Dr on 8/17/2015 at approximately 10:15am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date it was observed that the weeds / grass were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches on the property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Description: Observation: TV placed for rubbish not picked up
LetterText:
8/17/2015

Current Occupant
114 Semmens St
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following was observed on property located at 114 Semmens St Wilkins Township, Lot & Block #454-P-178, on 8/17/2015 at approximately 12:30pm. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

On this date it was observed that at some point a television was placed at the curb for rubbish collection, however, this type of electronic is no longer accepted by the Township refuse hauler.  The tv can be taken to Best Buy to be recycled free of charge or if no longer accepted  there a company called eLoop in Plum (877-742-4809) will take the set and properly dispose of it.  If the set remains at the curb it will be considered an accumulation of rubbish and subject to receiving a notice of violation of Township ordinance. 

Additionally, Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 states; Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.  Please refrain from placing containers or items at the curb prior to this requirement.  A copy of this notice will also sent to the listed property owner.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider

Description: Rubbish placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day
LetterText:
8/19/2015

Roland, Tracey Rebecca
3738 E Rural Ct
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following was observed on property located at 3738 E Rural Ct on 8/19/2015 at approximately 11:25am. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #715  Garbage  Rubbish  Recycling ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On this date it was observed that bags of what appeared to be rubbish were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled refuse pick up day for this street.  Please refrain from placing items at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Miller, Tanya M

The following was observed on property located at 734 Negley Ave on 8/20/2015 at approximately 10:00am. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish ***
Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

On this date it was obserevd that rubbish / garbage containers were left at the curb side after the scheduled collection day for this. LetterText:
8/20/2015

Givens, Ashley
1125 Rodi Rd
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

The following code violation was observed on property located at 132 Leneake St on 8/20/2015 at approximately 12:00pm. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** Wilkins Township Ordinance #814 Chapter 135-5 G Standards and Regulations for Collection of Garbage and Rubbish ***
Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

*** 308.2 Disposal Of Rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

*** 308.3.2 Containers ***
The operator of every establishment producing garbage shall provide, and at all times cause to be utilized, approved leakproof containers provided with close-fitting covers for the storage of such materials until removed from the premises for disposal.

On this date based upon a report from Wilkins Township police of a possible rat infestation or harborage at this property it was observed that the rubbish / garbage containers had no lids and were left at the curb past the scheduled collection day and which they had  contents in them that could be a potential attraction for rodents.  Although no rodents were seen at the time, keeping the containers in this manner is in violation of Township ordinance.  Please remove the containers to their storage location away from the curb and utilize close-fitting lids on the containers. 

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal. Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

8/24/2015

Fannie Mae
14221 Dallas Parkway Ste 1000
Dallas, TX 75254

The following code violation was observed on property located at 124 Frazier Dr Lot & Block #541-N-54 on 8/24/2015 at approximately 11:22am. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date it was observed that the weeds / grass were in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain a grass height of less than eight inches on the property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled. LetterText:
8/31/2015

Parisi, Carmelo & Cristina Amon
2 Grayhurst Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 2 Grayhurst Dr on 8/31/2015 at approximately 12:40pm. 

*** Notice Of Violation: Wilkins Township Ordinance #1013 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 (Prosecution of Violation) and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction.  Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On this date as a follow up to a notice dated 8/12/2015 it was observed that the weeds were still in excess of eight inches on this property.  Please maintain the weeds to a height of less than eight inches on the property.  This is a second notice.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #715  Garbage  Rubbish  Recycling ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection. On this date it was observed that items of what appeared to be rubbish were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled refuse pick up day for this street.  Please refrain from placing items at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day.  If the items remain in this location past the timeframe to comply with this notice they will be considered an accumulation of rubbish and subject to additional notices for violation of the Borough's property maintenance ordinance.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

Description: Bagster bulk container in the side yard for a few weeks
LetterText:
9/1/2015

Kowalecki, Marla M
3860  W Rural Ct
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

The following was observed on property located at 3860 W Rural Ct on 9/1/2015 at approximately 12:50pm. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** Churchill Borough Ordinance #726  Bulk Containers ***
Registration and permit required for any use of a bulk container in excess of thirty days.  A permit must be obtained from the Borough by filing an application which shall identify the purpose, placement and proposed location of the bulk container.

On this date it was observed that a "Bagster" type dumpster has been in the front yard of this property for a few weeks.  This type of dumpster is considered a bulk container and subject to the requirements of the enacted ordinance if the unit will remain in place.

Please let this letter serve as a reminder that if the container remains on site past the first week in October a permit will need to be obtained.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

Oberservation of property.

LetterText:
9/2/2015

Trustee of Shaquille Jones Special Needs 
3311 Scathelocke Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

The following code violation was observed on property located at 3311 Scathelocke Rd on 9/2/2015 at approximately 1:00pm. 

*** Notice of Violation: Churchill Borough Ordinance #722 Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

On this date it was observed that two inoperable motor vehicles are being kept or stored in the driveway of this property.  A blueish in color Honda with no license plate displayed and a grey Ford van with an expired registration of 5/15 displayed on PA plate# HVE-1701 are considered inoperable due to expired license on no license displayed on the vehicles.  Please make the vehicles operable with current licenses or have them removed from the premises or properly stored.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and or lien placed upon the real estate.

You have the right to an appeal.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

LetterText:
9/10/2015

Duncan, Mitchell W
807 Larimer Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 807 Larimer Ave, Lot & Block 454-L-122, on 9/10/2015 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** Chapter 173 Article IV Zoning General Regulations***

***§173-19 A (1) Fences***
A vegetation hedge or fence no more than 48 inches in height may be erected in the front and side yard of any structure, except on corner lots.

On 9/10/2015 it was observed that the vegetation hedge in the front yard appeared to be greater than 48 inches in height.  Please be aware that Wilkins Township regulates the height of hedges under current Zoning regulation.  Please maintain the hedges in the front yard to a height of less than 48 inches.

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the Wilkins Township Zoning Hearing Board.  The appeal must be filed with the proper application form and filing fee submitted to the municipal building within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.

Description: Second notice for inopoerable motor vehicle
LetterText:
9/14/2015

Walker, Nancy M
657 Mortimer Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 657 Mortimer Ave, Lot & Block 454-J-099, on 9/14/2015 at approximately 11:20am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 9/14/2015 as a follow up to a notice dated 8/6/2015 regarding an inoperable motor vehicle being parked or stored on this property, it was observed that the vehicle (a tan Chrysler Ciarus PA plate #JPA-4983) remains inoperable with an expired (5/15) registration plate being displayed.  Please make the vehicle operable with current license or remove it from the premises.  This is a second notice.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals. LetterText:
9/16/2015

Gentile, Carl M
2330 Forest Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 2330 Forest Dr on 9/16/2015 at approximately 10:50am. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On 9/16/2015 it was observed that bags of what appeared to be rubbish was placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street in violation of the Code.  Please remove the rubbish and refrain from placing items at the curb prior to the provisions of the Code. 

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

Merrell, Alton

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1635 Georgetown Pl on 9/18/2015 at approximately 12:20pm. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

LetterText:
9/24/2015

CGI Properties Llc
3829 Brampton Island Ct N
Jacksonville, FL 32224

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 600 Mcmasters Ave, Lot & Block #455-B-302 on 9/23/2015 at approximately 10:00am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

On 9/23/2015 it was observed that this property was vacant and creating a blighting problem due to numerous public health and safety issues such as being an unsecured and open vacant structure, accumulation of rubbish and garbage, high weeds and rodent harborage.  Please make the structure secure to prevent unauthorized entry, remove the accumulated rubbish, maintain the weeds to a height of less than eight inches and provide for proper precautions to prevent rodent harborage.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

Description: Inoperable motor vehicle being stored or parked on the property looks liked expired inspection 1/15
LetterText:
9/24/2015

Anderson, Danielle N
441 Clugston Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 441 Clugston Ave on 9/24/2015 at approximately 12:05pm. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 9/24/2015 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle, blue/grey mini-van displayed expired inspection of 1/15, is being parked or stored on this property in violation of the Code.  Please make the vehicle operable with current license or remove it from the premises.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 448 Woodland Hills Dr on 10/14/2015 at approximately 12:45pm. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness). On 10/14/2015 it was observed that 2 containers of rubbish were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street in violation of the Code.  Please remove the rubbish and refrain from placing items at the curb prior to the provisions of the Code.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 817 Elizabeth St on 10/15/2015 at approximately 10:40am. 

*** Chapter 135 Article I Solid Waste Collection and Storage ***

Placement of container(s) at curbside may be no earlier than 5:00 p.m. on the day prior to the designated collection day and must be removed from curbside to the storage place no later than 6:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** §308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

***§308.2.2 Refrigerators***
Refrigerators and other similar equipment not in operation shall not be discarded, abandoned or stored on premises without first removing the doors.

On 10/15/2015 it was observed that numerous items were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day or being kept or stored in the front yard of this property in violation of several provisions of the Code.  Please remove and properly dispose the rubbish that has accumulated in the front yard and please maintain the property in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Code Enforcement Officer

The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On 10/20/2015 it was observed that 2 rubbish containers were either not removed from the curb side or being stored at the entrance area for the access lane for your property in violation of the Code.  One container was plainly marked with the numbers 3404.  Please remove all rubbish containers that belong to you from the curb and properly store them on your property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Protective treatment on exterior siding peeling flaking not weather resistant
LetterText:
10/20/2015

Noel, Mark S
3403 McCrady Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 3403 Mccrady Rd on 10/20/2015 at approximately 09:15am. 

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

*** §304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

On 10/20/2015 it was observed that the siding of the house on this property is showing signs of deterioration with peeling and flaking paint in addition to untreated surfaces in violation of the Code.  It appears that some work has been done to the siding and the equipment is still in place however no progress has been observed on the repair to the deteriorated siding.  Please provide for a protective treatment on the deteriorated siding that protects it from the elements of decay.  If the work cannot be completed within the timeframe specified due to inclement weather or temperature please contact this office to provide a plan of action for a remedy to the situation.  

You have ninety (90) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.



Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-17 Collection Procedures for Leaves ***
Collection of leaves may be made on such days of the week and at such times as shall be determined by the Borough Council or the Borough Manager. Leaves for collection shall be placed in paper biodegradable bags. Leaves shall not be placed in plastic bags. The collector shall employ suitable equipment that will properly confine the leaves so that they will be transported over streets of the Borough without spillage or littering of the streets.

On 10/20/2015 it was observed that leaves had been collected into piles along the lot line of an adjoining property to yours.  Please follow the provisions of the Code for the collection of leaves that if they are collected they be placed in approved bags.  This will also help to prevent the collected leaves from being blown out of the piles prior to disposal.  If you have any questions on the collection procedures or scheduled pick up days please contact the Borough offices at 412-241-7113

All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled. On 10/21/2015 it was observed that rubbish has accumulated by the curb and on the porch of this property, additionally a motorcycle appears to have been abandoned as junk, in violation of the Code.  Please remove all accumulated rubbish and inoperable motor vehicles from the property.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider, Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 302 Princeton Dr on 11/5/2015 at approximately 10:30am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 11/5/2015 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle is being stored or kept in the driveway of this property in violation of the Code.  A white Isuzu Trooper appeared to be inoperable due to displaying an expired registration plate #EPB-7441.  Please remove the inoperable vehicle from the premises or make it operable with current license displayed.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

Pittsburgh, PA 15221

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-17 Collection Procedures for Leaves ***
Collection of leaves may be made on such days of the week and at such times as shall be determined by the Borough Council or the Borough Manager. Leaves for collection shall be placed in paper biodegradable bags. Leaves shall not be placed in plastic bags. Collection of leaves may be made on such days of the week and at such times as shall be determined by the Borough Council or the Borough Manager. Leaves for collection shall be placed in paper biodegradable bags. Leaves shall not be placed in plastic bags. The collector shall employ suitable equipment that will properly confine the leaves so that they will be transported over streets of the Borough without spillage or littering of the streets.

On 11/18/2015 it was observed that the leaves on this property were not collected by placing in biodegradable containers but were collected and piled by the street curb causing the leaves to be scattered an accumulate on the street in violation of the Code.  If leaves are to be collected they must be placed into proper containers for disposal and not blown or piled along the street curbs.  Please follow the provisions as regulated by the Code for the collection and disposal of leaves.  If further information regarding the collection of leaves and the days they will be collected please contact the Borough office at 412-241-7113.  This is a second occurrence of this violation of Code.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

*** Chapter 135 Article I Solid Waste Collection and Storage ***

LetterText:
12/2/2015

Pushinsky, Michael J & Deborah J
491 Brown Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 491 Brown Ave on 12/2/2015 at approximately 11:10am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 12/2/2015 as an ongoing follow up to notices sent 4/23/2015 and 7/6/2015 regarding inoperable motor vehicles being stored or kept on the property it was observed that 4 vehicles remain on the property.  Significant progress has been made towards compliance with the Code and continued cooperation is appreciated to resolve this matter.  Please remove the remaining inoperable vehicles from the premises or make them operable mechanically and with current license.  

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice. LetterText:
12/10/2015

Klink, Rachael or Current Occupant
891 Stevendale Drive
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 891 Stevendale Dr on 12/10/2015 at approximately 12:00pm. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 12/10/2015 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle was being porked or kept in the driveway of this property in violation of the Code.  A dark red in color Toyota Camry PA plate #JPR-5072 parked in the driveway of the property appeared to be inoperable due to a flate rear passenger tire.  Please remove the vehicle from the premises or make operable by repairing the tire.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal. Description: Weeds and debris (leaves) accumulated in the driveway, propert was being auctioned this fall no indication of the outcome
LetterText:
12/14/2015

Elcesser, Paul Dana & Wendy Lou 
3011 Shepard Ln
Sewickley, PA 15143

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 984 Elizabeth St, Lot & Block #372-R-066, on 12/14/2015 at approximately 11:40am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** §304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure.  Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

On 12/14/2015 it was observed that leaves and debris were accumulated within the driveway and gutters and additionally weeds in excess of eight inches have grown up along the sidewalk of this property.  Please remove all accumulated debris from the driveway and gutters and maintain the weeds to a height of less than eight inches on the property. 

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.



Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Obringer, Sarah
2260 Beulah Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 2260 Beulah Rd on 12/15/2015 at approximately 1:00pm. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On 12/15/2015 it was observed that a mattress was placed at the curbside prior to the scheduled collection day for this street in violation of the Code.  Please place items for rubbish collection as regulated by the provisions of the Code.  If the mattress is not removed it would be considered an accumulation of rubbish and in violation of Borough Code.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.
