Description: Inoperable motor vehicle being stored parked or kept on the grassy vacant lot directly adjacent to this property
LetterText:
12/16/2015

Berry, Louis L Sr
657 Larimer Ave  Apt 2
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 657 Larimer Ave on 12/16/2015 at approximately 10:25am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

*** §302.8.2 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored in any residential yard area not part of a garage driveway.

On 12/16/2015 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle was being parked or stored in the yard area of this property in violation of the Code.  A green in color Ford Escape with no license plate displayed and a missing or broken rear driver's side window and was parked on the grassy yard area directly adjacent to this parcel appeared to be in an inoperable state.  Please remove the vehicle from the premises or make operable with current license and inspection.  In addition no motor vehicle is to be parked or stored in the residential yard area of a property unless an approved space is provided for using crushed stone or other similar driveway material.  If you are not the owner or in control of this vehicle in question please inform my office so assistance can be obtained from Wilkins Police to identify the appropriate individual. 

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal. LetterText:
12/21/2015

Gallippi, William
131 Powell St
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 131 Powell St on 12/21/2015 at approximately 09:30am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §308.2.1 Rubbish Storage Facilities ***
The owner of every occupied premises shall supply approved covered containers for rubbish, and the owner of the premises shall be responsible for the removal of rubbish.

*** §308.3.2 Containers ***
The operator of every establishment producing garbage shall provide, and at all times cause to be utilized, approved leakproof containers provided with close-fitting covers for the storage of such materials until removed from the premises for disposal.

On 12/21/2015 it was observed that rubbish and garbage contents were being stored in containers without the use of lids in violation of the Code.  The containers on the front patio had contents being stored in them without lids in place to prevent the contents from overflowing the containers and to prevent rodents from scattering the garbage prior to the scheduled collection day.  Please provide and cause to be used close-fitting lids on all rubbish and garbage containers storing contents until disposal.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 4/4/2016 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle is being parked or stored on this property in violation of the Code.  A small, black in color, passenger car was observed to be inoperable due to not having a registration plate displayed being parked or stored in the driveway along the garage of this property.  Please remove the inoperable motor vehicle from the premises, make operable by providing with current license or store within an approved structure.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection. Description: 3 Inoperable vehicles remain on the property.  Business appears to have closed
LetterText:
1/11/2016

Pushinsky, Michael J & Deborah J
491 Brown Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 491 Brown Ave on 1/11/2016 at approximately 11:00am 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 1/11/2016 as a continued follow up to the most recent notice dated 12/2/2015 regarding inoperable motor vehicles being kept or stored on the property it was observed that the property remains in violation of the Code.  Three inoperable vehicles were being parked, kept or stored on the exterior parking area of the property.  The tan Chevy pickup plate #YWG-7893, blue Dodge van plate #3068H and the black Ford Bronco plate #GYK-2152 were all in an inoperable condition due to expired inspection and/or registration.  Please remove the vehicles from the premises, have them properly stored within a suitable structure or make them operable and capable of being driven on the public roadways.  Your continued cooperation is appreciated however, failure to comply within the timeframe of the notice will result in a citation filed with the local District Magistrate.  

You have twenty (20) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.




Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.  If a course of action is already planned please contact my office to advise when the vehicles are scheduled to be in compliance. 412-372-3831

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1635 Georgetown Pl on 1/20/2016 at approximately 12:00pm. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On 1/20/2016 it was observed that rubbish containers were left at the curb in violation of the Code.  Two rubbish containers were left or remained at the curb after being emptied by the refuse hauler.  Please remove the conatiners from the curbside and follow the provisions of the regulation regarding the collection procedures for rubbish.

1/21/2016

Scrivofilo, Frank  & Patricia M
303 Dunbar Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 303 Dunbar Dr on 1/21/2016 at approximately 10:55am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.7 Accessory Structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

On 1/21/2016 it was observed that the accessory structure at the rear of the property was not in good repair in violation of the Code.  The lean to structure or shed roofed accessory structure attached to the rear of the house was observed to be in a deteriorated condition.  The roof of the structure appeared to have numerous holes along the outer edge.  Please repair, replace or remove the accessory structure so that it is structural sound and in good repair.

You have ninety (90) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Accumulation of rubbish along Thompson Run Rd by the access gate prior to the underpass.  Tires were dumped onto the property along the tracks. Approximately 30-50 tires by estimation
LetterText:
1/21/2016

Union Railroad
1200 Penn Ave  Ste 300
Pittsburgh, PA 15222

The following was observed on Railroad property, Lot & Block #0454-L-00400-0009-00, located in Wilkins Township along Thompson Run Road at a gated entrance to a service road on 1/21/2016 at approximately 12:15pm. 

*** Observation ***
Oberservation of property. Notice of Violation not warranted at this time.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On 1/21/2016 it was observed that rubbish in the form of tires has accumulated on the service road next to the tracks along Thompson Run Road.  It appeared to be approximately 30 - 50 tires accumulated as rubbish inside the access gate for the service road prior to the underpass on Thompson Run Road.  Please remove the accumulated rubbish and properly dispose of the tires or if they are to serve a useful purpose for a project please properly store the tires in an approved storage structure. 

You have sixty (60) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals. Occupancy Inspection
Rubbish placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day
LetterText:
1/26/2016

Murphy, Robert T & Fern Hast-murphy
40 Holland Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 40 Holland Rd on 1/26/2016 at approximately 10:45am. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On 1/26/2016 it was observed that rubbish was placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for the street in violation of the Code.  Several black bags of what appeared to be rubbish were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day.  Please remove the rubbish from the curb and place items for collection as regulated by the provisions of the Code.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Duncan, Mary Frances
29 Barton Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 29 Barton Dr on 1/29/2016 at approximately 11:15am. 

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

*** §304.10 Stairways, Decks, Porches and Balconies ***
Every exterior stairway, deck, porch and balcony, and all appurtenances attached thereto, shall be maintained structurally sound, in good repair, with proper anchorage and capable of supporting the imposed loads.

On 1/29/2016 it was observed that the rear porch was deteriorated and not in good repair in violation of the Code.  The porch attached to the left rear of this residence was viewed from the street and appeared to be in a significantly deteriorated condition and not in good repair.  Please contact this office within 30 days to arrange for an inspection of the rear porch to determine if it is structural sound and capable of supporting imposed loads or within those 30 days repair, replace or provide for an alternative course of action to resolve the deteriorating conditions.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice. Description: Conditions remain unchanged and blighted. Citation R0084765-2 filed /for conditions
LetterText:
2/8/2016

Conner, Howard D
C/O - CGI Properties LLC
3829 Brampton Island Ct N
Jacksonville, FL 32224

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 600 McMasters Ave, Lot & Block #455-B-302, on 2/8/2016 at approximately 12:30pm. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

On 2/8/2016 as a continued follow up to notices dated 9/23/2015, 12/2/2015 and 1/7/2016 it was observed that the blighted conditions remain in violation of the Code.  It was observed that this property was still vacant and creating a blighting problem due to numerous public health and safety issues such as being an unsecured and open vacant structure, accumulation of rubbish and garbage, high weeds and rodent harborage.  A citation has been filed with the local District Magistrate for failure to comply with previous notices.  Additional citations will be filed if the property is not secured and maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition and the accumulated rubbish is not removed. 

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

On 2/9/2016 it was observed that rubbish was placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street in violation of the Code.  Items of what appeared to be rubbish were placed at the end of the driveway along the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street.  Please remove the containers from the curbside and place items for collection as regulated by the provisions of the Code.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
2/18/2016

Conner, Howard D
C/O - CGI Properties LLC
3829 Brampton Island Ct N
Jacksonville, FL 32224

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 600 McMasters Ave, Lot & Block #455-B-302, on 2/18/2016 at approximately 09:15am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §108.1 Unsafe Structure, General ***
When a structure or equipment is found by the code official to be unsafe, or when a structure is found unfit for human occupancy, or is found unlawful, such structure shall be condemned pursuant to the provisions of this code.

*** §108.1.3 Structure Unfit for Human Occupancy ***
A structure is unfit for human occupancy whenever the code official finds that such structure is unsafe, unlawful or, because of the degree to which the structure is in disrepair or lacks maintenance, is insanitary, vermin- or rat-infested, contains filth and contamination, or lacks ventilation, illumination, sanitary or heating facilities or other essential equipment required by this code or because the location of the structure constitutes a hazard to the occupants of the structure or to the public.

On 2/18/2016 it was observed that this structure is unfit for human occupancy in violation of the Code.  This property has been posted as unfit for human occupancy due to the structure being in disrepair and lacks ventilation, illumination, sanitary and heating facilities.  Please secure the structure and close all access to prohibit entry so as not to be an attractive nuisance.

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.





Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 2/18/2016 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle is being parked, kept or stored on this property in violation of the Code.  A dark blue passenger vehicle was observed parked in the pull-off driveway and appeared to be unlicensed.  Please make the vehicle operable with current license or properly stored within an approved structure or remove the vehicle from the premises.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

LetterText:
3/4/2016

Eles Brothers Company Inc
1000 Thompson Run Rd
Monroeville, PA 15146

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1235 Rodi Rd on 3/3/2016 at approximately 3:15pm. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 3/3/2016 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle is being parked or stored on this property in violation of the Code.  A white dump truck with PA plate #ZGS-2583 was observed parked in front of the garage building along Rodi Road.  The inspection sticker displayed appeared to be 2/16 making the vehicle it inoperable due to expired inspection as of the end of February.  Please make the vehicle operable with current inspection, remove it from the property or have it properly stored within an approved building. 

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 3826 Rural Ct W, Lot & Block #372-E-144 on 3/15/2016 at approximately 12:45pm 

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

*** §301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** §304.1 Exterior Structure, General ***
The Exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare.

*** §304.13 Window, Skylight and Door Frames ***
Every window, skylight, door and frame shall be kept in sound condition, good repair and weather tight.

*** §304.13.1 Glazing ***
All glazing materials shall be maintained free from cracks and holes.

*** §308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On 3/15/2016 it was observed that this property was vacant and in violation of Borough Code.  A basement window on the right side of the home was broken and not secured to prevent unwanted entry.  Rubbish was accumulated to the rear of the property in the area of the back deck with containers holding unknown contents.  Please take appropriate measures to secure the property against unwanted entry from rodents or people and remove all accumulated rubbish from the exterior of the property.  Efforts to maintain this property to prevent further blighting conditions will be greatly appreciated.  If you are not the responsible party for this property please contact this office. 

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

*** Chapter 236 Article I Residential Storage ***

No person, partnership or corporation shall establish or maintain or permit to exist in the
Borough of Churchill any storage yard or other place used for the storage of goods, materials,
machinery, equipment, things or vehicles (whether operable or inoperable) in the residential
districts of the borough.

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth. On 3/23/2016 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle was being parked or stored in the driveway of this property in violation of the Code.  A black Jeep with PA plate #HNW-7852 was observed to be inoperable with two driver's side flat tires being parked or stored in the driveway of this property.  Please remove the inoperable vehicle from the premises or make operable as regulated by the provisions of the Code.

3/29/2016

Stein Alan R
1708 Williamsburg Pl
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1708 Williamsburg Pl on 3/29/2016 at approximately 12:00pm. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

*** §252-17 Collection Procedures for Leaves ***
Collection of leaves may be made on such days of the week and at such times as shall be determined by the Borough Council or the Borough Manager. Leaves for collection shall be placed in paper biodegradable bags. Leaves shall not be placed in plastic bags. The collector shall employ suitable equipment that will properly confine the leaves so that they will be transported over streets of the Borough without spillage or littering of the streets.

On 3/29/2016 it was observed that items were placed or stored at the curb in violation of the Code.  Several black plastic trash bags of what appeared to be rubbish or leaves / yard waste were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street.  Please place items for collection as regulated by the provisions of the code.  The location of the bags to the property line made it unclear as to which property is responsible for the placement, therefore a copy of this notice is being sent to both adjoining property owners.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.



Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1710 Williamsburg Pl on 3/29/2016 at approximately 12:00pm. 

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

*** §252-17 Collection Procedures for Leaves ***
Collection of leaves may be made on such days of the week and at such times as shall be determined by the Borough Council or the Borough Manager. Leaves for collection shall be placed in paper biodegradable bags. Leaves shall not be placed in plastic bags. The collector shall employ suitable equipment that will properly confine the leaves so that they will be transported over streets of the Borough without spillage or littering of the streets.

On 3/29/2016 it was observed that items were placed or stored at the curb in violation of the Code.  Several black plastic trash bags of what appeared to be rubbish or leaves / yard waste were placed at the curb prior to the scheduled collection day for this street.  Please place items for collection as regulated by the provisions of the code.  The location of the bags to the property line made it unclear as to which property is responsible for the placement, therefore a copy of this notice is being sent to both adjoining property owners.


You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.



Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
3/31/2016

Miller, Paul S & Alberta C
7 Aspen Dr
Irwin, PA 15642

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 665 Larimer Ave on 3/31/2016 at approximately 10:00am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 3/31/2016 it was observed that the sanitation and a motor vehicle on this property were in violation of the Code.  This notice is to reinforce what was discussed with the occupants based on our meeting today at this property in identifying what still needs to be removed to improve exterior sanitary conditions in addition to the removal of the inoperable motor vehicle.  

Some progress has been made in removing the accumulated rubbish however the property is still not in compliance.  Please remove all rubbish (small pieces of debris, plastic, paper and other scattered items) from the front, side and rear area of the property.  Please remove or make operable the dark in color passenger vehicle with flat tires PA plate #JTV-6122 expired 2/16 and inspection displayed expires 3/16 within the timeframe specified.  Copy of this notice is being provided to the listed owner of record and the listed occupants.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice for sanitation and thirty (30) days for the vehicle.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Exterior protective treatment is compromised leaving the property exposed to the elements and effects of weather, rubbish from contractor remains in the driveway and front hillside remains overgrown and debris scattered throughout 09:45
LetterText:
4/8/2016

Global Scope LLC
10801 Saville Court
Bowie, MD 20721

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 3302 Scathelocke Rd, Lot & Block #0452-N-00044, on 4/8/2016 at approximately 09:45am. 

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

*** §304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

*** §308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

On 4/8/2016 it was observed that this property was in violation of multiple property maintenance Codes.  The wood shake for the mansard roof / siding was removed leaving the structure open and exposed to the elements.  Approximately a dozen black plastic bags of rubbish are accumulated in the driveway in addition to the pile of removed wood shakes.  Also, various items of trash (plastic bags, bottles, cups and paper) are scattered about the driveway and front hillside along the curb of this property.  Weeds in excess of six inches, leaves and similar yard debris is overgrown and accumulated on the front hillside of the property.  Please repair, replace or provide for protective treatment of the exterior portions of the structure to make weather tight and provides protection from the elements.  Please remove all accumulated rubbish from the property or store in approved containers until such time it can be removed.  Also, please remove all weeds in excess of six inches from the front hillside along the curb.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

*** Chapter 236 Article I Residential Storage ***

*** §236-1 Prohibited Acts ***
No person, partnership or corporation shall establish or maintain or permit to exist in the
Borough of Churchill any storage yard or other place used for the storage of goods, materials,
machinery, equipment, things or vehicles (whether operable or inoperable) in the residential
districts of the borough.

All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On 4/13/2016 as a follow up to the notice dated 4/1/2016 it was observed that the condition was unchanged in the driveway of this property and remains in violation of the Code.  A microwave, tub surround, leaves and cardboard were accumulated as rubbish in the driveway.  Additionally, it appeared a motorcycle was being stored under a blue tarp in the driveway.  Please remove the accumulated rubbish from the driveway and properly store the motorcycle in an approved structure when not in use for extended periods of time.  This is the second notice.

LetterText:
4/14/2016

Lazarus, Janet L
270 George Ln
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 270 George Ln on 4/14/2016 at approximately 11:35am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 4/14/2016 it was observed that an inoperable motor vehicle was being parked, kept or stored on this property in violation of the Code.  A green in color, possibly a Ford Ranger, pickup truck with PA plate #YMT-7900 was observed to be inoperable with a flat rear passenger tire parked, kept or stored in the driveway of this property.  Please make the vehicle operable as regulated by the provisions of the code, store it in an approved structure or remove it from the premises. 

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

The exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare.

*** §304.10 Stairways, Decks, Porches and Balconies ***
Every exterior stairway, deck, porch and balcony, and all appurtenances attached thereto, shall be maintained structurally sound, in good repair, with proper anchorage and capable of supporting the imposed loads.

*** Chapter 252 Article III Collection and Disposal ***

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection. Approximately a dozen containers (black plastic bags) of what appeared to contain rubbish was observed to be placed at the curbside prior to the scheduled collection day for this street. ObservationInfo: Heard PD being dispatched to this address for a neighbor complaint of a barking dog, stopped w/ PD in front of the residence and did not hear any barking. LetterText:
5/2/2016

Pushinsky, Michael J & Deborah J
491 Brown Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 491 Brown Ave on 4/28/2016 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** Chapter 173 Article V Signs ***

*** §173-34J (2) Prohibited Signs ***
Any obsolete sign panel or sign copy which identifies, describes, directs attention to or gives directions for locating any business or establishment no longer in operation, or advertises any product or service no longer being marketed, shall be removed within 90 days after becoming obsolete. Covering obsolete sign panels or sign copy with any material is specifically prohibited.

On 4/28/2016 it was observed that sign(s) on this property were in violation of the property maintenance and zoning Code.  The freestanding metal pole sign in front of the building was dislodged from its base and fell onto the entrance wires of this property creating an unsafe condition.  Additionally, the sign observed was for a business, A 1 Automotive, no longer in operation.  Please remove the fallen sign and all signs indicating the business or services of this establishment that is no longer in operation.  

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.



Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: 2 inoperable motor vehicles remain on the lot, owner pled guilty to the citation but issue still remains
LetterText:
5/2/2016

Pushinsky Michael J & Deborah J
491 Brown Ave
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 491 Brown Ave on 4/28/2016 at approximately 11:30am. 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

On 4/28/2016 it was observed that two inoperable motor vehicles remain parked, kept or stored on this property in violation of the Code.  Two inoperable motor vehicles are still being stored on the exterior of this property.  The district magistrate's office indicated you pled guilty to the citation filed regarding this condition however, the vehicles still need to be removed to prevent additional citations being filed.  Please remove the two inoperable vehicles from the exterior of this property.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Description: Stopped and attempted contact n/a front door 2:00pm will be sending notice regarding soil erosion due to the missing section of retaining wall
LetterText:
5/3/2016

Thomas, Benjamin F Jr & Barbara A
42 Churchill Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the Churchill Borough Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 42 Churchill Rd on 5/3/2016 at approximately 2:00pm. 

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***

*** §302.2 Grading and Drainage ***
All premises shall be graded and maintained to prevent the erosion of soil and to prevent the accumulation of stagnant water thereon, or within any structure located thereon.

On 5/3/2016 it was observed that soil was being eroded and accumulated on the access drive of this property in violation of the Code.  It appears that when the section of damaged retaining wall was removed in August of 2015 and subsequently not repaired or rebuilt has created a condition causing the erosion of soil from the hillside and from beneath the upper portion of Churchill Road.  The eroded soil washes down and is accumulating along the private access drive in the front of your property.  A remedy will need to be put in place to keep the soil and rest of the hillside from eroding and or causing more of the retaining wall from being compromised.  Please repair or replace the damaged section of the retaining wall located on the front of your property.  I stopped this date to discuss this issue but there was no answer at the front.

You have fortyfive (45) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jason Heider
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the Wilkins Township Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 4063 Miller St on 5/4/2016 at approximately : 2:00 PM

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions***

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

On 5/4.2016 It was observed that the weeds/grass where in excess of eight inches on this property in violation of the Code.  It was also observed that there was garbage outside of a container upon the front yard near the front door of the dwelling.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals. You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

LetterText:
5/5/2016

Barry Peter J
3112 Deerwood Dr
Allison Park, PA 15101

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 705 Thompson St on 5/4/2016 at approximately : 

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***


*** §304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

You have five (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

5/4/2016 It was observed that the siding of the building on this property was pealing away from the wall, exposing the wood underneath.  Please repair or replace the siding to create a weather resistand and water tight treatment to the side of the building on this property

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Frost Robert J & Catherine B
193 Carr Way
East Pittsburgh, PA 15112

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Township of Wilkins.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 193 Carr Way on 5/25/2016 at approximately : 2:00 PM

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***


*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

*** §308.3 Disposal of Garbage ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of garbage in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such garbage in an approved garbage disposal facility or approved garbage containers

On 5/25/2016 It was observed that there was an inoperable boat, an inoperable motor home, an inoperable blue mini van, and a red car with an expired registration on the property mentioned above.  It was also observed that there was garbage dispersed upon the ground near the driveway as well as a garbage bag not in an approved container.  Please place the garbage in an approved container and either remove, or repair and register the the motor vehicles in violation of code §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles

You have Thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***


*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** §304.3 Premises Identification ***
Buildings shall have approved address numbers placed in a position to be plainly legible and visible from the street or road fronting the property.  These numbers shall contrast with their background.  Address numbers shall be Arabic numerals or alphabet letters.  Numbers shall be a minimum of 4 inches in height with a minimum stroke width of 0.5 inch. 

On 5/25/2016 It was observed that at 409 Cline St, the grass was at a height that exceeded township code.  It was also observed that there was an accumulation of rubbish in the form of home appliances and other such objects being stored in piles near the garage doors of the house and along the wall that is below cline st.  It was also observed that the premise identification was either absent or in a place where it could not be plainly legible and visible from the street or road fronting the property.

You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

LetterText:
{Date}

{OwnerName}
{OwnerAddress1}
{OwnerAddress2}

This notice is being sent on behalf of the .  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at {PropertyAddress}on {EventDate} at approximately : 

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
A certain document, three copies of which are on file in the office of the Borough Secretary of the Borough of Pitcairn, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2006 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of Pitcairn, in the State of Pennsylvania, for regulating and governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Property Maintenance Code on file in the office of the Borough of Pitcairn are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 302.7 Accessory structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

*** §5-304 1.11.3 Unsafe Conditions ***
All structures or existing equipment that are or hereafter become unsafe or deficient because of inadequate means of egress facilities, or that constitute a fire hazard or are otherwise dangerous to human life or the public welfare, or that involve illegal or improper occupancy or inadequate maintenance, shall be deemed unsafe. A vacant structure that is not secured against entry shall be deemed unsafe. Unsafe structures or equipment shall be reported to the building code official, who shall take appropriate

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

{CodeOfficer}
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
5/31/2016

Mendicino Fred F
618 Taylor Ave
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 718 9th Ston 5/11/2016 at approximately : 11:00

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
A certain document, three copies of which are on file in the office of the Borough Secretary of the Borough of Pitcairn, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2006 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of Pitcairn, in the State of Pennsylvania, for regulating and governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Property Maintenance Code on file in the office of the Borough of Pitcairn are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: high grass, siding falling off of the house, absent on right side of house.
LetterText:
5/31/2016

Lang David Scott & Marie B Cain
207 Brinton Ave
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the .  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 207 Brinton Aveon 5/16/2016 at approximately : 11:00 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: delapidated sidewalk
Delapidated Sidewalk
LetterText:
6/1/2016

Matthews Todd C
921 Westbury Rd
North Versailles, PA 15137

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 425 2nd Ston 6/1/2016 at approximately : 11:30 AM

*** §21-302. Duty of Property Owners to Repair Sidewalks. ***
Every owner of property in the Borough shall, on 30 days notice from the Borough
Council, which notice may be written or printed, or partly written and partly printed,
repair the sidewalk in the manner stipulated in such notice in front of and/or alongside
such property. Provided, where a nuisance results from the condition of a sidewalk, and
the safety of pedestrians is immediately jeopardized, the Borough may abate the
nuisance, with or without notice, and may collect the cost thereof in the same manner
and to the same extent as in other cases of the abatement of nuisances. Provided
further, the Borough shall also have the power to make emergency repairs to sidewalks,
where such repairs can be made by an expenditure of not more than $500, following 48
hours notice, as authorized in the Borough Code, 53 P.S. §46806(b).
(Ord. 646, 6/20/1962, §2; as amended by Ord. 978, 5/31/2011)

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.3 Sidewalks and driveways ***
All sidewalks, walkways, stairs, driveways, parking spaces and similar areas shall be kept in a proper state of repair, and maintained free from hazardous conditions.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer
