Description: Siding absent from front porch
LetterText:
6/6/2016

Burke John F
297 Hill St
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 593 6th Ston 6/6/2016 at approximately : 10:00 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On 6/6/2016 it was observed that a protective treatment was absent from the wood on the face of the front porch.  Please maintain the house and accessory structures to have a protective treatment.

You have Thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Churchill.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 2504 Churchill Rd on 6/7/2016 at approximately : 1:30 PM

*** Chapter 236 Article II Property Maintenance Code ***


*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §302.8 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

On 6/7/2016 It was observed that an unregistered vehicle was parked in the driveway of the property mentioned above.  It was also observed that the weeds/grass had grown to a height that exceded Borough code.  Please maintain the weeds to a height less than six inches and either remove the vehicle or have it registered and inspected.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

6/17/2016

Parente Nathan
605 Brinton Ave
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 605 Brinton Ave on 6/17/2016 at approximately : 12:00 PM

*** §4-301. Construction, Etc.; Permit Required ***
No person, corporation, partnership, company or other entity shall construct, install, add to or alter a fence in the Borough, unless a permit is secured therefore.

*** §4-302. Location and Height Limitations ***
No fence shall be constructed which exceeds any of the following height limitations:
A. Location. No fence may be erected in the front yard (closer the street than the front building line). All fences must be erected with the finished side facing other properties and not facing inward. All fences must comply with all other provisions of this Code of Ordinances.
B. Forty-eight inches in front of the building line applicable to the subject property.
C. Seventy-two inches, for all zones except Industrial, behind the front building line applicable to the subject property, except as otherwise provided in paragraph .D below.
D. No fence may be erected which obstructs the required clear sight triangle at any intersection.
E. Ninety-six inches in any Industrial zoning district.

On 6/17/2016 It was observed that on the property of 605 Brinten Ave a fence was erected along the sidewalk of sixth street withought a permint and in excess of the height restrictions, with the finished side facing in toward 605 Brinton.  Please obtain a permit for the fence, and correct the fence to be within Borough Code.

You have Twenty-One (21) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

*** Chapter 124 Article I Property Maintenance Code Provisions ***


*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled. LetterText:
7/8/2016

Marino Rosanna M
420  E Main St
Carnegie, PA 15106

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 662 6th Ston 7/8/2016 at approximately : 9:45 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On 7/8/2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds on this property exceeded borough code.  It was also observed that the siding on the side of the house is falling off of the house.  Please maintain the gras/weeds to a height less than six inches.  Also, please repair/replace the siding on the house to be in proper functioning order. 

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** § 4-202 OCCUPANCY ***
No dwelling house, apartment or other living quarters, commercial establishment,
building, premises or structure may be occupied when there is a change in status or
change in occupancy, owner, occupant, or tenant after the date of this Part until such
time as the owner or his agent has secured an occupancy permit.

You have seven (7) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
7/11/2016

Mcbride David J
4049 Route 130
Irwin, PA 15642

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 545 5th Ston 7/11/2016 at approximately : 10:00 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

You have seven (7) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled. All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Wilkins Township.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 707 Mcmasters Ave on 7/13/2016 at approximately 1030 AM. 

*** §304.1 General ***
The exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare.

*** §304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure.  Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

Please apply new paint to structure where current paint is peeling.  Apply shingles to roof where there are none and evaluate, or have evaluated, the deterioration along the roof line, to the structure, and take approriate actions to correct the issue.

7/25/2016

Croce Richard A & Barbara I
824 White Farm Rd
Indiana, PA 15701

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 226 Hillside Aveon 7/22/2016 at approximately : 1:00 PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 307.3.1 Garbage facilities ***
The owner of every dwelling shall supply one of the following: an approved mechanical food waste grinder in each dwelling unit; an approved incinerator unit in the structure available to the occupants in each dwelling unit; or an approved leakproof, covered, outside garbage container.

*** 307.3.2 Containers ***
The operator of every establishment producing garbage shall provide, and at all times cause to be utilized, approved leakproof containers provided with close-fitting covers for the storage of such materials until removed from the premises for disposal.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***


*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** § 4-202 OCCUPANCY ***
No dwelling house, apartment or other living quarters, commercial establishment,
building, premises or structure may be occupied when there is a change in status or
change in occupancy, owner, occupant, or tenant after the date of this Part until such
time as the owner or his agent has secured an occupancy permit.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

On July 27, 2016 It was observed that mattresses, garbage, and other furniture where being stored on the front porch of the house and on the sidewalk, with garbage scattered from the bag it was stored in across the sidewalk.  It was also observed that the house is to be occupied although it is condemned and deemed unsuitable for occupancy.  Please remove the garbage and rubbish in an approved manner, and refrain from allowing occupancy of the house.  Also you must maintain the house and the property and bring it into compliance of code. 

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

7/29/2016

Marino Rosanna M
420  E Main St
Carnegie, PA 15106

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 662 6th Ston 7/29/2016 at approximately : 9:45AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On July 29, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds on the property exceded Borough code.  It was also observed that the siding on the house is peeling off, and the decorative shutters on the house are damaged.  Please maintain the property to be in compliance with code.  

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

7/29/2016

Niyibizi Emmanuel
117 Gaymor Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15214

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 374 Broadway on 7/29/2016 at approximately : 11:00 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 307.3 Disposal of garbage ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of garbage in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such garbage in an approved garbage disposal facility or approved garbage containers.

*** 308.3.1 Garbage Facilities.***
The owner of every dwelling shall supply a leakproof, covered, outside garbage container.

On July 29, 2016 It was observed that there where bags of garbage being kept along the rear of the property nit in cans.  There where also large amounts of various types of rubbish.  The occupants stated that they did not have enough garbage cans, and also that the garbage was not taken when left out on garbage day.  Please  provide the required garbage facilities for the tennants of the property, and be sure that all garbage and rubbish is being disposed in an appropriate manner.  

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
8/2/2016

Mcwhinney James R & Edna Mae
4329 Golden Mile Hwy
Murrysville, PA 15668

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 521 5th St on 8/2/2016 at approximately : 2:15PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 301.2 Responsibility ***
The owner of the premises shall maintain the structures and the exterior of the property in compliance with these requirements, except as otherwise provided for.

On August 2, 2016 it was observed that the structure at the address stated above was in serious delapidated condition, enough so to cause blight to the community.  No progress has been made since the first violation notice that was mailed on May 13, 2016.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height less than six inches and begin rectifying the conditions of the house to meet borough code.

You have twenty one (21) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
8/4/2016

Dixon Darin A & Patricia P
3074 Terra Maria Way
Ellicott City, MD 21042

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 957 5th Ave, Apt -959on 8/4/2016 at approximately : 1:51PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition. The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On August 4, 2016 it was observed on the property stated above that the siding on the house is damaged and falling off, the paint on the front porch is chipping and peeling away, the garbage behind the garage near the alley way was knocked over and scattered across the yard and street, and rubbish in the form of garbage bags and an old television where being stored on the side porch of the house.  Please remove all garbage and rubbish and dispose of it in an approved manner and make the necessary repairs to the weatherproofing of the house.

You have fourteen (14) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

The exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare.

Description: Discovered that the property is not vacant, but people are living in it.  A tennant let me in to look at her property, the house was not up to code
LetterText:
8/5/2016

Jankovik William R
Po Box 283
Murrysville, PA 15668

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 382 3rd Ston 8/5/2016 at approximately : 10:30AM

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
A certain document, three copies of which are on file in the office of the Borough Secretary of the Borough of Pitcairn, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2006 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of Pitcairn, in the State of Pennsylvania, for regulating and governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Property Maintenance Code on file in the office of the Borough of Pitcairn are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

On August 5, 2016 it was observed that the paint on the property mentioned above is peeling off and cracked.  It was also observed that the grass/weeds where in excess to what is required by code.  Also, after speaking with tennants and being let into the building it was observed that the living units are not up to the standards of the International Property Maintainance Code.  The deficiencies where that there needs to be screens in ever openable window, smoke alarms in all sleeping areas, outside of all sleeping areas and on each floor of the building, the paint can not be chipping and in a state of decay, all kitchen countertop receptacles must be GFCI receptacles, and all electrical components must function properly.  Please repair all damaged electrical equipment, maintain the grass to a height less than six inches, repair the paint on the sides of the house, install all necessary smoke alarms, and install all necessary screens.  

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.8 Motor vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled. Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth. Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

The owner of every dwelling shall supply one of the following: an approved mechanical food waste grinder in each dwelling unit; an approved incinerator unit in the structure available to the occupants in each dwelling unit; or an approved leakproof, covered, outside garbage container.

LetterText:
9/7/2016

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 606 Brinton Aveon 9/7/2016 at approximately : 2:44PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** § 305.3 INTERIOR SURFACES ***
Interior surfaces, including windows and doors, shall be maintained in good, clean and sanitary condition.  Peeling, chipping, flaking or abraded paint shall be repaired, removed or covered.  Cracked or loose plaster, decayed wood and other defective surface conditions shall be corrected.

*** 304.1 EXTERIOR STRUCTURES ***
The exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 605.1 Electrical Equipment Installation ***
Electrical equipment, wiring and appliances shall be properly installed and maintained in a safe and approved manner.

On September 7, 2016 it was observed that the siding on the house was damaged.  It was also observed that the front porch was damaged and parts are falling off.  The interior of the house was observed to have electrical problems with the GFCI in the laundry room, as well as structural damage at the base of the stairs, plumbing issues in the upstairs bathroom, and other damage too the house.  It was determined that the tennants where not the cause of these problems due to observing their sanitary and normal living style, but neglect to repair and maintain the house by the landlord is the underlying cause of the delapidation.  Please repair the issues with the interior and exterior of the house and maintain the house in good condition and in compliance with the borough code.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1334 Broadway Ston 9/8/2016 at approximately : 11:30AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 304.10 Stairways, decks, porches and balconies ***
Every exterior stairway, deck, porch and balcony, and all appurtenances attached thereto, shall be maintained structurally sound, in good repair, with proper anchorage and capable of supporting the imposed loads.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On September 8, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds where at a height that exceeds borough code.  It was also observed that the building is vacant and in a delapidated state, with damaged front steps, soffet missing from the building and damage to the house.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height of less than eight inches and repair the house and maintain the building to be within compliance of the borough code. 

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Turtle Creek, PA 15145

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Wilkins Township .  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 631 Mortimer Ave on 9/12/2016 at approximately 1045 AM.

*** §304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

Exteriors of both garages have portions of deteriorated pritective coatings.  Please have exteriors of garages evaluated and repaired to protect the structures.  You have twenty obe (21) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

LetterText:
8/8/2016

Golden Oil Company
Po Box 275
Oakdale, PA 15071

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1153 5th Aveon 8/8/2016 at approximately : 3:00PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***
A certain document, a copy of which is on file in the office of the Secretary of the Borough of East McKeesport, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code of 2003, as amended, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of East McKeesport, County of Allegheny, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; for the control of buildings and structures as herein provided; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions, and terms of said International Property Maintenance Code are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On August 8, 2016 it was observed on the property listed above that the vacant structure and land had grass/weeds at a height that exceeded borough code, the parking lot is in a severe delapidated state, and the building has cracked windows and damaged siding.  Please make all appropriate repairs to the building and parking lot, and maintain the grass/weeds to a height of less than eight inches.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Buildings shall have approved address numbers placed in a position to be plainly legible and visible from the street or road fronting the property.  These numbers shall contrast with their background.  Address numbers shall be Arabic numerals or alphabet letters.  Numbers shall be a minimum of 4 inches in height with a minimum stroke width of 0.5 inch. 

*** §308.1 Accumulation of Rubbish or Garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

You have fourteen  (14) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.3 Sidewalks and driveways ***
All sidewalks, walkways, stairs, driveways, parking spaces and similar areas shall be kept in a proper state of repair, and maintained free from hazardous conditions.

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior  of the structure.  Drains, Gutters and Downspouts shall be maintained in good repair.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition. The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

***  §10-103. F Public Nuisance***
The draining or allowing to drain, by natural or artificial means, any foul
or offensive liquid of any kind, from any premises into, upon or along any other
premises, public right of way or public lands, except where provision has been made
for the lawful drainage of such liquid in such manner and at such place. The
existence of such drainage prior to the passage of this Part, shall not make such
activity or condition lawful.

Description: Occupancy without permit.  Siding falling off of house, fescia falling off of house.
LetterText:
8/10/2016

Ruby Jennifer
1524 Oblock Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15239

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 907 Brinton Aveon 8/10/2016 at approximately : 10:00AM

*** § 4-202 OCCUPANCY ***
No dwelling house, apartment or other living quarters, commercial establishment,
building, premises or structure may be occupied when there is a change in status or
change in occupancy, owner, occupant, or tenant after the date of this Part until such
time as the owner or his agent has secured an occupancy permit.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On August 10, 2016 it was observed that there was a person living at the house of 907 Brinton Ave, Pitcairn PA, although no occupancy permit was given for this premise.  It was also observed that the siding on the upper right side of the house is falling off of the house, and the soffet/fescia on the house is damaged and falling off as well.  Please repair the protective treatment on the house and obtain an occupancy permit for the premise.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Pool outside with green water in it, high grass/weeds
LetterText:
8/10/2016

Mcre Llc
Po Box 116
Hunker, PA 15639

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 636 6th Ston 8/10/2016 at approximately : 10:00AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** § 10-602. I. VECTOR CONTROL, STANDING WATER ***
To have, keep, maintain, cause or permit any collection of standing or flowing water in which mosquitoes breed or are likely to breed, unless such collection of water is treated or maintained so as effectually to prevent such breeding

On August 10, 2016 it was observed that on the property noted above there was a small inflatable pool in the back yard, with water in it that had grown algae from sitting placid for a length of time.  It was also observed that the grass/weeds on the property are at a height that exceed borough code.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height less than six inches, and also either maintain the water in the pool as to prevent the breeding of mosquitos or remove the pool.  

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 822 Florence Aveon 8/11/2016 at approximately : 3:00PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 302.7 Accessory structures.  ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

On August 11, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds on the property where at a height that exceeded code.  It was also observed that the fence in the rear of the building was damaged, and leaning over in disrepair.  Please repair the fence and maintain the grass/weeds to a height of less than eight inches.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

*** §301.2 Responsibility ***
The owner of the premises shall maintain the structures and the exterior of the property in compliance with these requirements, except as otherwise provided for in this code.  A person shall not occupy as owner-occupant or permit another person to occupy premises which are not in a sanitary and safe condition and which do not comply with the requirements of this chapter.  Occupants of a dwelling unit, rooming unit or housekeeping unit are responsible for keeping in a clean, sanitary and safe condition that part of the dwelling unit, rooming unit, housekeeping unit or premises which they occupy and control.

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

Pitcairn Mini Mart missing siding on building, rubbish piles on side of building, high grass/weeds.
LetterText:
8/12/2016

Smankass2 Inc
7001 Lyons View Ct
Murrysville, PA 15668

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 401 Agatha St, Apt -417on 8/12/2016 at approximately : 1:00 PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On August 12, 2016 it was observed that on the Mini Mart, which is located at the address above, the siding is vacant/damaged.  Please repair/replace the siding of the Mini Mart.  Also there are piles of siding and other rubbish stored around the building, as well as grass/weeds that are at a height that exceed code.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height less than six inches, and removed the rubbish and dispose of it in an approved manner.

You have fourteen (14) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Massive amounts of rubbish stored on front porch, building downspouts not working, bags of rubbish along side of building.  Rubbish within the building as well.
LetterText:
8/12/2016

Kotvas Joseph C & Joan
1480 Judy Ln
Monroeville, PA 15146

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 316 Broadway on 8/12/2016 at approximately : 1:30PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior  of the structure.  Drains, Gutters and Downspouts shall be maintained in good repair.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

On August 12, 2016 it was observed that the downspouts of the listed building above did not function properly, and where not connected to gutters or drains.  It was also observed that a great amount of rubbish in the form of old appliances, construction waist, unnused furniture, etc. were being stored on the front porch and within the vacant setions of the building.  Please repair the gutters and drains on the building and remove all of the rubbish on the front porch, within the building, and around the building in an approved manner.

You have twenty one(21) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

8/15/2016

Luchkiw Andy
524 Seninole St
East Mc Keesport, PA 15035

This notice is being sent on behalf of the East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 524 Seminole Ston 8/15/2016 at approximately : 2:00PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On August 15, 2016 it was observed that rubbish in the form of broken furniture, old home appliances, and automotive parts where stacked along the sides of the building and piled inbetween the large red barn structure and the grey house/garage.  It was also observed that he grey building was missing the required protective treatment on the wood that surrounds the garage door.  Also much of the aluminum fescia was missing from the side and front of the building.  Please remove all rubbish and dispose of it in an approved manner.  Aslo repair and install the protective treatment required on the building.  

*** 307.2 Disposal of rubbish ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such rubbish in approved containers.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

LetterText:
8/15/2016

Gomez Carlos A & Marcia Gregg
121 Hampton St
Wall, PA 15148

This notice is being sent on behalf of the East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 0 Seminole St on 8/15/2016 at approximately : 2:00PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***
A certain document, a copy of which is on file in the office of the Secretary of the Borough of East McKeesport, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code of 2003, as amended, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of East McKeesport, County of Allegheny, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; for the control of buildings and structures as herein provided; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions, and terms of said International Property Maintenance Code are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

On August 15, 2016 it was observed that rubbish in all forms, including broken furniture, construction waist, motor vehicle parts, old appliances, etc. where being stored along the walls of the exterior of the building in piles, as well as being in one massive pile within the building.  The doors to the building building was observed to be open and not secured.  The paint on the building was delapidated and chipping and peeling from the building.  Please remove all rubbish and dispose of it in an approved manner, secure the building to be inaccessable to intruders, and repair/replace the protective treatment on the building.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer
