This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 436 Eleanor Ston 8/17/2016 at approximately : 9:00AM

*** §6-301. Disorderly Conduct Prohibited. ***
Disorderly conduct, as defined in the Pennsylvania Crimes Code, 18 Pa.C.S.A.
§5503, is hereby prohibited within the Borough. A person is guilty of disorderly conduct
if he:
A. Engages in fighting or in threatening, violent or tumultuous behavior.
B. Makes unreasonable noise.
C. Creates a hazardous or physically offensive condition by any act which
serves no legitimate purpose of the actor.
Provided: as used in this Section, the word public means affecting or likely
to affect persons in a place to which the public or a substantial group has access.
Among the places included are streets, alleys and sidewalks, transport facilities,
schools, prisons, apartment houses, places of business or amusement, any
neighborhood, or any premises which are open to the public.

On August 17, 2016 it was observed that a grey Buick Lesabre, License plate JSE 2768, which is owned by the occupants of the property noted above had the horn locked to be engaged.  No occupants of the house answered when I knocked, and the horn had been engaged for nearly an hour.  Please repair the vehicle so that the horn does not engage in a way to cause disorderly conduct.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice. Description: Building leaking water through basement window, damaged shingles, damaged siding, causing water damage to inside of house.
LetterText:
8/17/2016

Non-profit Services Llc
1080 Red Tail Holw
Washington, PA 15031

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 404 Eleanor St, Apt 404-414on 8/17/2016 at approximately : 9:00AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** § 305.3 INTERIOR SURFACES ***
Interior surfaces, including windows and doors, shall be maintained in good, clean and sanitary condition.  Peeling, chipping, flaking or abraded paint shall be repaired, removed or covered.  Cracked or loose plaster, decayed wood and other defective surface conditions shall be corrected.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior  of the structure.  Drains, Gutters and Downspouts shall be maintained in good repair.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition. The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

On August 17, 2016 it was observed that at the property listed above there where several code violations due too the delapidated state of the structure.  Upon investigation of apartment 408 it was found that the shingles where damaged and failing, allowing water into the house and causing damage.  The gutter on the rear of the building was damaged at the rear of the appartment causing it to fail.  The basement is flooding from the basement window.  There seems to be some sort of black mildew lining the carpets and walls.  There is flooding coming from underneath the non functioning dishwasher.  The ceiling fan is loose and not installed correctly.  Please repair all of the items that are not in compliance with code.  It was also observed that the tennants are sanitary and properly maintaining the areas that they control.

You have twenty-one (21) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

,  

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1003 Broadway Ston 8/18/2016 at approximately : 10:30AM

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On August 18, 2016 it was observed that the property listed above has grass/weeds that exceed borough code.  It has also been noted that there are several complaints about rodents living in the vacant structure.   Please maintain the structure free from rodents, and maintain the grass/weeds to a height of less than eight inches.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

Description: Delapidated house, gutters falling off house, roof severely delapidated, shingles falling off house, back porch in serious state of decay.  Hedges not trimed.
LetterText:
8/18/2016

Smith Robert W & Patricia A
804 Florence Ave
East Mc Keesport, PA 15035

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 804 Florence Aveon 8/18/2016 at approximately : 2:00PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 304.7 Roofs and drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain. Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure. Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions. Roofwater shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 304.10 Stairways, decks, porches and balconies ***
Every exterior stairway, deck, porch and balcony, and all appurtenances attached thereto, shall be maintained structurally sound, in good repair, with proper anchorage and capable of supporting the imposed loads.

On August 18, 2016 it was observed that the property listed above had extensive decay and delapidation of the roof and drainage system.  The gutter on the front porch is damaged, and falling off of the house.  The shingles and roof of the house are damaged to the point of falling apart and off of the house.  The porch on the rear of the house is in a major state of decay, having the floor rotted away and truss being damaged.  Please either repair or replace the gutters, roof, and shingles of the house, as well as the fescia board on the building.  Either remove or repair the deck on the rear of the building.  Also, be sure that all windows are leak proof, and the protective treatments on the house are functioning properly and in good repair.

You have 30 (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection. The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

Description: High grass/weeds.  Junk Motorcycle in back yard
LetterText:
8/19/2016

Hoy Betty L
411 3rd St
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 411 3rd Ston 8/19/2016 at approximately : 10:30AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 302.8 Motor vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative or unlicensed motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled. Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth. Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes.

On August 19, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds on the property around the fence, house, and in the back yard are at a height that exceeds code.  It was also observed that there is a junk motorcycle being stored in the back yard at the rear of the house.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height less than six inches and remove the junk motor vehicle, or maintain the vehicle in an operable condition.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
8/19/2016

Krynicke Elmer
436 3rd St
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 436 3rd Ston 8/19/2016 at approximately : 11:00AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

*** 304.1 EXTERIOR STRUCTURES ***
The exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On August 19, 2016 it was observed that the property listed above was in a state of delapidation causing blighting of the community.  The siding on the building is peeling off and damaged, the concrete and foundation of the front porch are severely damaged and in a state of delapidation, the fescia board on the front porch is damaged and decaying, the roof to the rear porch is damaged and decaying, the storm doors are not fascened as to prevent trespassing, and various forms of rubbish including old phone books, news papers, damaged furniture, and demolition waste lie in piles on the front and rear porch, as well as within the house.  Please remove all rubbish, maintain the grass/weeds at a height less than six inches, and maintain the building to be safe and secure, and in good repair.

You have twenty one (21) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 304.10 Stairways, decks, porches and balconies ***
Every exterior stairway, deck, porch and balcony, and all appurtenances attached thereto, shall be maintained structurally sound, in good repair, with proper anchorage and capable of supporting the imposed loads.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 304.7 Roofs and drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain. Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure. Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions. Roofwater shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On August 24, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds at 310 Broadway where at e height that exceeded borough code.  It was also observed that there was rubbish and garbage accumulated around the building in the form of a large amount of cigarette butts along the wall in the alley, plastic plates, and other disposable kitchen materials.  It was observed that the cigarette butts are being thrown over the balcony of one of the apartments by tennents or their guests.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height less than six inches, and remove and dispose of all garbage and rubbish around the premise in an approved manner. This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 450 Broadway on 8/24/2016 at approximately : 2:00PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of garbage in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such garbage in an approved garbage disposal facility or approved garbage containers.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 302.7 Accessory structures.  ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

*** 304.7 Roofs and drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain. Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure. Roof drains, gutters and downspouts shall be maintained in good repair and free from obstructions. Roofwater shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

On August 25, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds on the property where at a height that exceeded borough code.  It was also observed that the garage attached to the propertywas in a state of delapidation, having damage too the roof, and gutters damaged and failing.  Please repair the garage and maintain the grass/weeds on the property to a height less than eight inches.

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection.  However, no containers shall be placed at the curbside earlier than 6:00 pm, prevailing time, on the day prior to collection.  Exceptions may be granted on an individual basis by the Borough Manager for occasional, special circumstances (e.g. illness).  The owner should remove containers placed at curbside on the same day after being emptied by the contractor.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

Please traim ALL overgrown weeds/grass on property into compliance in order to provide a safe and sanitary environment.  You have ten (10) days to comply with this notice.   Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Brian Scofield

LetterText:
9/29/2016

Breakey Gerald E & Sharren C
717 Broadway Ave
East Mc Keesport, PA 15035

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 717 Broadway Ston 9/29/2016 at approximately : 9:45 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***
A certain document, a copy of which is on file in the office of the Secretary of the Borough of East McKeesport, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code of 2003, as amended, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of East McKeesport, County of Allegheny, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; for the control of buildings and structures as herein provided; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions, and terms of said International Property Maintenance Code are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** §10-302. Nuisance ***
Any grass, weeds, ornamental tree or shrub or other vegetation growing upon any premises in said Borough in violation of §10-301 of this Part is hereby declared to be a nuisance and detrimental to the health, safety and welfare of the inhabitants of the Borough.

On September 29, 2016 it was observed that the weeds in the rear of the property listed above were at a height and in a condition that violated borough code.  The weeds in the rear of the property obstructed the view of the alley due to the growth of the weeds and lack of maintenance.  Please maintain the grass/weeds on the property to a height of less than eight inches, and prevent the weeds from obstructing the alley way.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.   Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
9/29/2016

Spinelli Angelo M & Rose Marie
1031 5th Ave
East Mc Keesport, PA 15035

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1031 5th Aveon 9/29/2016 at approximately : 2:30PM

*** §19-104.7 Sign Maintenance, Repair and Removal ***
Every sign permitted by this Part shall bekept in good condition and repair. When any sign becomes insecure, in danger of falling or is otherwise deemed unsafe by the code official, or if any sign shall be unlawfully installed, erected or maintained in violation of any of the provisions of this Part, the owner thereof or the person or firm using same shall, upon written notice by the code official forthwith in the case of immediate danger, and in any case within not more than 10 days, make such sign conform to the provisions of this Part, or shall remove it. If within 10 days the order is not complied with, the code official shall be permitted to remove or cause such sign to be removed at the expense of the owner and/or the user of the sign.

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***
A certain document, a copy of which is on file in the office of the Secretary of the Borough of East McKeesport, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code of 2003, as amended, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of East McKeesport, County of Allegheny, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; for the control of buildings and structures as herein provided; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions, and terms of said International Property Maintenance Code are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On September 29, 2016 it was observed that on the property stated above the sign for the store was damaged and delapidated.  It was also observed that at the door facing 5th street, directly across from Reenes diner the wood siding was damaged and delapidated, and the paint was peeling off.  Please repair the sign and the siding, and be sure that all paint is in good condition.

You have twenty-one (21) days to comply with this notice.   Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

*** §252-15 Collection Procedures for Rubbish ***
	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection. Description: High grass
LetterText:
8/26/2016

Dotan Josef R
2 Arlington Pl
Fair Lawn, NJ 7410

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 740 10th Ston 8/26/2016 at approximately : 11:45 AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

On August 26, 2016 it was observed that the grass/weeds on the property noted above was at a height that exceeded borough code.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height of less than six inches.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

Description: Exposed wood on front porch, chipped paint on foundation and missing.
LetterText:
8/29/2016

Canova James J
916 Josephine St
East Mc Keesport, PA 15035

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 916 Josephine Ston 8/29/2016 at approximately : 11:00AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On August 29, 2016 it was observed that the wood on the front porch railing of the building listed above was delapidated and suffering from water damage due to not having a protective coating.  It was also observed that large sections of the sandstone foundation has had the paint pealed off due to a lack of maintenance.  Please repair the wood on the front porch and apply a protective coating to it, and repair the coating on the sandstone as to prevent delapidation of the foundation.

You have Thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Wilkins Township .  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 228 Kingston Dr on 8/30/2016 at approximately 0900 AM. 

*** §302.8.1 Motor Vehicles ***
Except as provided for in other regulations, no inoperative, unlicensed or uninspected motor vehicle shall be parked, kept or stored on any premises, and no vehicle shall at any time be in a state of major disassembly, disrepair, or in the process of being stripped or dismantled.  Painting of vehicles is prohibited unless conducted inside an approved spray booth.  Exception: A vehicle of any type is permitted to undergo major overhaul, including body work, provided that such work is performed inside a structure or similarly enclosed area designed and approved for such purposes, but not including a tarp.

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

There has been an ongoing case with respect to the two (2) inoperable vehicles in the drive way.  I will put my personal number below by my name in this letter.  If I do not hear from you within two weeks then I may have to proceed with court action.  You have fourteen (14) days to comply with this notice. *** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 302.9 Defacement of property ***
No person shall willfully or wantonly damage, mutilate or deface any exterior surface of any structure or building on any private or public property by placing thereon any marking, carving or graffiti.  It shall be the responsibility of the owner to restore said surface to an approved state of maintenance and repair.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 368 2nd Ston 8/31/2016 at approximately : 10:30

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
 
*** 307.1 Handrails and Guardrails general ***
Every exterior and interior flight of stairs having more than four risers shall have a handrail on one side of the stair and every open portion of a stair, landing, balcony, porch, deck, ramp or other walking surface that is 30 inches above the floor or grade below shall have guards.  Handrails shall be not less than 30 inches in height or more than 42 inches in height measure vertically above the nosing of the tread or above the finished floor of the landing.

On August 31, 2016 it was observed that the steps built for the front porch had posts, but no rails.  Please install rails in accordance to the borough code.

LetterText:
8/31/2016

Lang David Scott & Marie B Cain
207 Brinton Ave
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitciarn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 207 Brinton Aveon 8/31/2016 at approximately : 11:00AM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 304.1 EXTERIOR STRUCTURES ***
The exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 302.7 Accessory structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

On August 31, 2016 it was observed that the building listed above was missing siding on the entire right wall of the house, and the wood composing the wall showed extensive damage.  It was also observed that the fence in the rear was damaged/destroyed and laying in the back yard.  Please repair the house and maintain it to be within compliance borough code, and repair the fence and maintain it to be in compliance with borough code.

You have thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Code Enforcement Officer

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***

*** 304.1 EXTERIOR STRUCTURES ***
The exterior of a structure shall be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the public health, safety or welfare

*** 302.7 Accessory structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

*** 304.10 Stairways, Decks, Porches and Balconies ***
Every exterior stairway, deck, porch and balcony, and all appurtenances attached thereto, shall be maintained structurally sound, in good repair, with proper anchorage and capable of supporting the imposed loads.

*** 304.2 Protective Treatment***
Exterior surfaces shall be maintained in good condition and protected from the elements.  Peeling flaking and chipped paint shall be removed and the surfaces repainted.  Siding and masonry joints shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.

Description: No progress had been made to remove the water from the basement, it is stagnant and possibly sewage.  Delapidated face of building and protetive treatment failure.
LetterText:
9/1/2016

Hensley Stephen W & Valerie M
304 Lawrence Ave
North Versailles, PA 15137

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 1020 5th Ave, Apt -1024on 9/1/2016 at approximately : 2:30PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition. The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 301.3 Vacant Structures and Land ***
All vacant structures and premises thereof or vacant land shall be maintained in a clean, safe, secure and sanitary condition as provided herein so as not to cause a blighting problem or adversely affect the public health or safety.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

On September 1, 2016 it was observed that the treatment on the face of the building is damaged and pealing off.  It was also observed that a large amount of water is pooling in the basement stairwells of the building and sitting stagnant creating a noxious oder and remaining a breeding ground for insects and pests.  Please repair the building to be within compliance of borough code and remove the water, and prevent further collection of water on the premises.

You have Thirty (30) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of East McKeesport.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 958 5th Aveon 9/1/2016 at approximately : 2:30PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code ***

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens. Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

You have fifteen (15) days to comply with this notice.  Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice. LetterText:
9/14/2016

Aboud Marian E S & Nasib
571 Lucia Rd
Pittsburgh, PA 15221

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Wilkins Township.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 571 Lucia Rd on 9/14/2016 at approximately 1200 PM.

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §302.7 Accessory Structures ***
All accessory structures, including detached garages, fences and walls, shall be maintained structurally sound and in good repair.

*** §304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment.  Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted.  All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

There has been an ongoing number of cases from our agency related to this property dating back to April of 2015.  Wilkinks Township has had various property maintainence related cases dating back to 2001.  Please correct all corrected violations that were recognized during this inspection, noted in this leeter.  If you need more specific instructions or would like to request more time to remedy these violations please call me at the number listed below.  You have fourteen (14) days to comply with this notice.   Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Brian Scofield
Code Enforcement Officer/Manager
(412) 419-8522

*** §10-802. Yard Sale Permit Required ***
1. It shall be unlawful for any individual, group, or corporation to conduct within the Borough a yard sale or permit a yard sale to be held within the Borough on residential property under the individual, group, or corporations control without first obtaining a yard sale permit from the Borough.  2. Any individual, group, or corporation conducting a yard sale within the Borough or outside the Borough limits or any individual, group, or corporation posting advertisements within the Borough limits for a yard sale to be held inside or outside the Borough limits shall remove from within the Borough right-of-way all signs, flyers, posters, and bulletins no later than the date after the yard sale. Should the yard sale for any reason not be held all signs, flyers, posters, and bulletins advertising the yard sale, must be removed no later than the scheduled last day for the yard sale.

*** 307.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage

on September 19 2016 it was observed that piles of furniture, appliances, toys and other objects where lying in the yard nearest to the parking area of the property listed above.  It was also observed that there was a sign in a planting pot that had the words, "yard sale" written on them facing towards the road.  Please remove the objects from the yard and prior to having a yard sale first obtain a permit for the yard sale.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Churchill Borough .  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 2260 William Penn Hwy on 9/20/2016 at approximately 1:00 PM. 

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** §304.2 Protective Treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences, shall be maintained in good condition.  Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. All siding and masonry joints, as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors and skylights, shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight.  All metal surfaces subject to rust and corrosion, and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion.  Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces.  Surfaces designed for stabilization are exempt from this requirement.

Electrical equipment, wiring and appliances shall be properly installed and maintained in a safe and approved manner.

Every habitable space in a dwelling shall contain not less than two separate and remote receptacle outlets.  Every laundry area shall contain not less than one grounding-type receptacle with a ground fault circuit interrupter.  Every bathroom shall contain not less than one receptacle.  Any new bathroom receptacle outlet shall have ground fault circuit interrupter protection.  All receptacle outlets shall have the appropriate faceplate cover for the location.

Washington, PA 15031

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 404 Eleanor St, Apt -414on 9/21/2016 at approximately : 2:00PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
A certain document, three copies of which are on file in the office of the Borough Secretary of the Borough of Pitcairn, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2006 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of Pitcairn, in the State of Pennsylvania, for regulating and governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Property Maintenance Code on file in the office of the Borough of Pitcairn are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition. The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 304.2 Protective treatment ***
All exterior surfaces, including but not limited to, doors, door and window frames, cornices, porches, trim, balconies, decks and fences shall be maintained in good condition. Exterior wood surfaces, other than decay-resistant woods, shall be protected from the elements and decay by painting or other protective covering or treatment. Peeling, flaking and chipped paint shall be eliminated and surfaces repainted. All siding and masonry joints as well as those between the building envelope and the perimeter of windows, doors, and skylights shall be maintained weather resistant and water tight. All metal surfaces subject to rust or corrosion shall be coated to inhibit such rust and corrosion and all surfaces with rust or corrosion shall be stabilized and coated to inhibit future rust and corrosion. Oxidation stains shall be removed from exterior surfaces. Surfaces designed for stabilization by oxidation are exempt from this requirement.

*** 304.7 Roofs and Drainage ***
The roof and flashing shall be sound, tight and not have defects that admit rain.  Roof drainage shall be adequate to prevent dampness or deterioration in the walls or interior  of the structure.  Drains, Gutters and Downspouts shall be maintained in good repair.  Roof water shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a public nuisance.

*** 605.1 Electrical Equipment Installation ***
Electrical equipment, wiring and appliances shall be properly installed and maintained in a safe and approved manner.

*** 506.2 Plumbing Maintenance ***
 Every plumbing stack, vent, waste and sewer line shall function properly and be kept free from obstructions, leaks and defects

*** 504.1 Plumbing System Fixtures ***
All plumbing fixtures shall be properly installed and maintained in working order, and shall be kept free from obstructions, leaks and defects and be capable of performing the function for which such plumbing fixtures are designed. All plumbing fixtures shall be maintained in a safe, sanitary and functional condition.

On September 21, 2016 it was observed that within the apartment of 404 Eleanor St there was extensive amounts of mold in the basement due to leaking of the foundation.  It was also observed that one of the GFCI outlets in the kitchen had been destroyed due to malfunction.  The basement sink leaked due to improper maintainence of the drain, as well did the sink in the bathroom for improper maintainance of the drainange system.  It was observed that extensive water damage had occurred to the ceiling just below the bathroom sink, and is continuing to grow due to proplems with the plumbing.  It was observed that the toilet had been disloged from the floor of the bathroom.

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Wilkins Township.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 817 Elizabeth St on 9/21/2016 at approximately 1005 AM.

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

	Containers designated for collection must be ready by 7:00 am on the day of collection. *** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of eight inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** §302.5 Rodent Harborage ***
All structures and exterior property shall be kept free from rodent harborage and infestation.  Where rodents are found, they shall be promply exterminated by approved processes which will not be injurious to human health. LetterText:
9/23/2016

Nsy Properties Llc
Po Box 213
Pitcairn, PA 15140

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 473 2nd Ston 9/23/2016 at approximately : 1:30 PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
A certain document, three copies of which are on file in the office of the Borough Secretary of the Borough of Pitcairn, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2006 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of Pitcairn, in the State of Pennsylvania, for regulating and governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Property Maintenance Code on file in the office of the Borough of Pitcairn are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition. The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

*** 302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches. All noxious weeds shall be prohibited. Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.  Upon failure of the owner or agent having charge of a property to cut and destroy weeds after service of a notice of violation, they shall be subject to prosecution in accordance with Section 106.3 and as prescribed by the authority having jurisdiction. Upon failure to comply with the notice of violation, any duly authorized employee of the jurisdiction or contractor hired by the jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter upon the property in violation and cut and destroy the weeds growing thereon, and the costs of such removal shall be paid by the owner or agent responsible for the property.

*** 308.3 Disposal of garbage ***
Every occupant of a structure shall dispose of garbage in a clean and sanitary manner by placing such garbage in an approved garbage disposal facility or approved garbage containers.

On September 23, 2016 it was observed that garbage was toppled out of the cans in the alley way and scattered throughout the alley was behind the property listed above.  It was also observed that the grass/weeds in the alley way where at a height that exceeds borough code.  Please maintain the grass/weeds to a height of less than six inches, and dispose of all garbage in an approved manner.  This is your final notice.

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.   Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer

LetterText:
9/23/2016

Abdulrahman Ali A
61 Camelot Ct
Pittsburgh, PA 15235

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Churchill Borough.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 61 Camelot Ct on 9/23/2016 at approximately 2:00 PM.

*** §302.4 Weeds ***
All premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of six inches.  All noxious weeds shall be prohibited.  Weeds shall be defined as all grasses, annual plants and vegetation, other than trees or shrubs provided; however, this term shall not include cultivated flowers and gardens.

*** §302.1 Sanitation ***
All exterior property and premises shall be maintained in a clean, safe and sanitary condition.  The occupant shall keep that part of the exterior property which such occupant occupies or controls in a clean and sanitary condition.

Please trim overgrown weeds/grass into compliance in order to provide for a safe and sanitary environment.  You have 14 (14) days to comply with this notice.   Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Brian Scofield
Code Enforcement Officer/Manager
412 419 8522

Appell Helen J

This notice is being sent on behalf of the Borough of Pitcairn.  A violation of the  Code ("Code") was observed on property located at 119 Brinton Aveon 9/23/2016 at approximately : 4:15PM

*** §5-201. Adoption of the Property Maintenance Code. ***
A certain document, three copies of which are on file in the office of the Borough Secretary of the Borough of Pitcairn, being marked and designated as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2006 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property Maintenance Code of the Borough of Pitcairn, in the State of Pennsylvania, for regulating and governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Property Maintenance Code on file in the office of the Borough of Pitcairn are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this Part, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in §5-202 of this Part.

*** 308.1 Accumulation of rubbish or garbage ***
All exterior property and premises, and the interior of every structure, shall be free from any accumulation of rubbish or garbage.

On September 23, 2016 it was observed that there was an accumulation of garbage bags filled with clothes, furniture, and other rubbish placed on the sidewalk in front of the house.  Please refrain from accumulating rubbish and dispose of all rubbish in an approved manner

You have five (5) days to comply with this notice.   Failure to comply may result in additional notices, citations, fines and/or a lien may be placed upon the property.

You have the right to an appeal to the International Property Maintenance Code Board of Appeals.  The appeal must be filed with the Turtle Creek Valley Council of Governments at 2700 Monroeville Boulevard Monroeville, PA 15146, within 20 days of the mailing of this notice.  You must make the request in writing, indicating the reason(s) or a time extension for this appeal.  An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of the Code or the rules legally adopted thereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of the Code do not fully apply, or the requirements of the Code are adequately satisfied by other means.

Your effort to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

 Jesse Lachimia
Code Enforcement Officer
